subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:35.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I82c3b74bb0346fa1742a97c00f2b5f3fb26263e9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I82c3b74bb0346fa1742a97c00f2b5f3fb26263e9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation
messages:
[{'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-06-06 10:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13192, 'date': '2018-06-06 14:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-06-07 00:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks for solving the problem! I agree with your current solution!'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-06-07 05:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

Merge it and fix the gate issue. Then release rokcy-2.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 10:09:59.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation

BlazarContext class raises an error when the class is instantiated
with unspported keys. The class is used as a context for RPC and
the RPC is implemented over oslo.messaging. If oslo.messaging
automatically adds a new key for the context, the RPC execution
fails since the new key is unexpected by BlazarContext and it
raises an error.

This patch relaxes the limitations in BlazarContext. If unexpected
keys are passed for the class instantiation, the class ignores the
keys.

Change-Id: Ibdca6eead0ee726bc10a07ee43e4ef10110d23e2
Closes-Bug: #1775363
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation

BlazarContext class raises an error when the class is instantiated
with unspported keys. The class is used as a context for RPC and
the RPC is implemented over oslo.messaging. If oslo.messaging
automatically adds a new key for the context, the RPC execution
fails since the new key is unexpected by BlazarContext and it
raises an error.

This patch relaxes the limitations in BlazarContext. If unexpected
keys are passed for the class instantiation, the class ignores the
keys.

Change-Id: Ibdca6eead0ee726bc10a07ee43e4ef10110d23e2
Closes-Bug: #1775363

subject: Remove direct tagging/branching for QA repos
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-06-06 12:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-06 12:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-07 01:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nThanks. lgtm'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-07 05:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 12:20:30.000000000', 'message': "Remove direct tagging/branching for QA repos

The release process for official OpenStack components
now uses release requests using changes proposed to the
openstack/releases git repository. This allows peer review
of release requests, including version numbers, and run a
series of checks to make sure the release is likely to be
successful once the tag is pushed. The same process
supports the creation of additional repo branches as well.
This all ensures that releases are reported correctly on
the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags
directly or create branches directly. There were a number
of old QA deliverables with stale ACLs, let's fix them.

Change-Id: I5a098095d87945517fb066a9aa125a481a96118a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove direct tagging/branching for QA repos

The release process for official OpenStack components
now uses release requests using changes proposed to the
openstack/releases git repository. This allows peer review
of release requests, including version numbers, and run a
series of checks to make sure the release is likely to be
successful once the tag is pushed. The same process
supports the creation of additional repo branches as well.
This all ensures that releases are reported correctly on
the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags
directly or create branches directly. There were a number
of old QA deliverables with stale ACLs, let's fix them.

Change-Id: I5a098095d87945517fb066a9aa125a481a96118a

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4660a35ff63f3f0212978dda668ba2cb08774e3a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
To cleanup the awaiting-state volume

For deleting all volumes which is in 'awaiting
-state' cleaning the volume transfer after creation
and acceptance.

Change-Id: Ib361289ac0111d92cc42ee2b686809906d58c830
Closes-Bug: #1268481

find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to
I9616a602ee0605f7f1dc1f47b6416f01895e025b landing in Pike, switching to
the use of the config classes to parse XML within this method.

Closes-bug: #1771700

commit_message:
libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices

In this latest episode of `Which CI job has lyarwood broken today?!` we
find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to the substantial refactoring of
_get_instance_disk_info via I9616a602ee0605f7f1dc1f47b6416f01895e025b,
for this change the test has been extended to provide valid XML via the
config classes.

Closes-bug: #1771700
Change-Id: I9653f81ec716f80eb638810f65e2d3cdfeedaa22
(cherry picked from commit fda48219a378d09a9a363078ba161d7f54e32c0a)
(cherry picked from commit 8ea98c56b647526aae7a786531e934eeee7a90a2)
(cherry picked from commit 43cac615f6a0a4399c7bf3dda6c2595749f27ace)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:18.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7c8264704ce7c570b981ed40dbe8c37321c170b1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7c8264704ce7c570b981ed40dbe8c37321c170b1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Integration tests for tagged attach

This tests nova microversion 2.49, tagged attach of network interfaces
and block devices.

Change-Id: I50b9aa168629457ce8270e456161727bd7b91a86
Implements: blueprint virt-device-tagged-attach-detach

commit_message:
[WIP] Kubeadm-aio container for kolla-k8s dev and gates

This PS brings in a container for setting up a Kubeadm based
AIO environment for development and gating purposes for Kolla-k8.

Partially-Implements : blueprint devenv-taketwo

Change-Id: I1ac7a13cc8cd092d5d75542d3dc7992d2f972dae

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 07:28:12.000000000', 'message': 'Re-base placement object unit tests on NoDBTestCase

The tests in test_resource_provider.py were originally subclasses of
test_objects._LocalTest because that provided the necessary basics for
testing versioned objects. Since the placement objects do not use RPC
and because these tests are very limited, this is not needed. The
tests have been changed to have NoDBTestCase as a grandparent with an
intervening parent class that sets self.context.

Where required, those tests which uses a database set USES_DB to True.
Subsequent patches will either remove or move these tests to functional
tests where they belong.

Change-Id: Ibf632cd3b4c0cf8fdff44a8a3272c637246f5b52
'}]
commit_message:
Re-base placement object unit tests on NoDBTestCase

The tests in test_resource_provider.py were originally subclasses of
test_objects._LocalTest because that provided the necessary basics for
testing versioned objects. Since the placement objects do not use RPC
and because these tests are very limited, this is not needed. The
tests have been changed to have NoDBTestCase as a grandparent with an
intervening parent class that sets self.context.

Where required, those tests which uses a database set USES_DB to True.
Subsequent patches will either remove or move these tests to functional
tests where they belong.

Change-Id: Ibf632cd3b4c0cf8fdff44a8a3272c637246f5b52

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: If3383707c9baf69e03bcccc50970da748a834141

[{'created': '2018-06-06 18:50:51.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifeed5b9c1357cbb00502c8c7d2932a5e2ad2e2a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Use "update" for container name instead "rename"
messages:
[{'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-06-04 07:45:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-06-05 04:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Shu,

While I was trying this patch, I spotted several issues on the update dialog. First, the 'update' bottom is disabled. Second, there are a few strange behavior when I kept clicking 'next'. Not sure if it is specific to me or it is generic. Will find another time to look into it."}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-06-06 01:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hongbin, thanks for reviewing. I check this patch again, but this works fine. I guess you adopted this patch after reviewing bp/add-params-rockey-1. If so, you may need to restart horizon and to clear browser cache using F5+ctrl key. Could you try this patch again?'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-06-06 03:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hongbin, thanks for reviewing. I check this patch again, but this
 > works fine. I guess you adopted this patch after reviewing
 > bp/add-params-rockey-1. If so, you may need to restart horizon and
 > to clear browser cache using F5+ctrl key. Could you try this patch
 > again?

@Shu,

This issue is unrelated to this patch. I hit the same issue in master. I can reproduce this issue in both chrome and firefox. I haven't review any other patch before. However, I guess it might be related to the version of Horizon, which is as below.

$ git log -1

Add new states for container

This patch applies new container states as follows:
* DELETING
* REBUILDING
* DEAD
* RESTARTING

Also, update validations for actions.

Change-Id: I42394eb04dcc9a224ccdc230f4773e3531d1306c

subject: Install EPEL repositories manually and exclude Python packages
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 01:29:57.000000000', 'message': "Install EPEL repositories manually and exclude Python packages

The EPEL repositories currently have conflicts with the OpenStack
RDO packages.  However, we don't need any Python packages from
EPEL therefore this will solve the conflicts and it will not
let it pull anything from EPEL.

Change-Id: I5fc6b4cbcd3d8ad207477603591f82ea8243a1c1
"}]
commit_message:
Install EPEL repositories manually and exclude Python packages

The EPEL repositories currently have conflicts with the OpenStack
RDO packages.  However, we don't need any Python packages from
EPEL therefore this will solve the conflicts and it will not
let it pull anything from EPEL.

Change-Id: I5fc6b4cbcd3d8ad207477603591f82ea8243a1c1

commit_message:
Add new options for container creation

This patch adds following options for container creation.
* auto_heal
* disk
* availablity_zones

Also, add these parameters into details views to show.
And change layouts to add these options.

This change requires python-zunclient 1.4.0 or later.

Change-Id: Ibb9e774ea379a9999c703d6919f14dd0a6e56857
Implements: blueprint add-params-rocky-1
Depends-On: I6c0512816277a63bbf444d0775121bb5d964a36a

commit_message:
Allow setting network-segment on subnet update

To enable the possibility to migrate a non-routed network to a
routed network allow updating the segment_id of a subnet.

Change-Id: I3ebae2ff28d5d4e5373ebd1f52194f8c52071b88
Partial-Bug: bug/1692490
Depends-On: I1aee29dfb59e9769ec0f1cb1f5d2933bc5dc0dc5

commit_message:
DNM Debug hosts

/etc/hosts is prepared for multinode, but its content does not help
with qemu name resultion during live migration.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/722649/

Debug to understand what's wrong (probably inventory names are injected
instead of proper hostnames.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/572313
Change-Id: Ib815cfe91af5bf9e526f57a2676008e8ce77975f

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I21491f302cbc6ca7a9b5ac12c487cf214bf4866e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 09:23:58.000000000', 'message': "[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337
(cherry picked from commit 465ad6f3197b8591a401a9f0db2fabf6c70fdfce)
"}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337
(cherry picked from commit 465ad6f3197b8591a401a9f0db2fabf6c70fdfce)

commit_message:
Don't share a network with all tenants

Other tenants may appreciate random networks not popping up for
miliseconds in their net-list; and other test cases executed in parallel
may also benefit, especially when they e.g. attempt to validate net-list
result; or boot an instance w/o specifying a port or network to use.

There is still more work on tempest tests side.

Original patch was for neutron-tempest-plugin:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550987/
and this is only backport to stable/Pike branch which still
uses tempest tests from neutron repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571676/
Change-Id: I88eaa1bb65482557912c2d304800d782e730a6b6
Closes-Bug: #1753209

commit_message:
Fix eventlet imports issue

With Ubuntu python package 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.3 and
evetlet < 0.22.0 there is some issue with eventlet monkey_patching.
This commit adds workaround solution ported from eventlet patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Change-Id: Ia381c98116765903bf2652acd175251233df4e54
Closes-Bug: #1745013
(cherry picked from commit 04efb3bca33cb4ca49f29e548866ad6f5d0ed359)

commit_message:
Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.

neutron-openvswitch-agent will refresh flows when it's restarted.
But the port's binding status is not changed, update_port_postcommit
will be skipped at function '_update_individual_port_db_status' in
'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', l2pop don't handle DVR ports, the
fdb entries about DVR port will not be added.

So, we can't skip DVR port at notify_l2pop_port_wiring when agent
is restared.

Closes-Bug: #1773286
Change-Id: I54e3db4822830a0c83daf7b5150575f8d6e2497b
(cherry picked from commit d0fa2c9ac50a783c410fab2df938974c4e829ffa)

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-06 18:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-06 18:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-06-06 21:49:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 18:51:26.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7f0cc773ddc6bdcf464574fc7faa9216db71e09
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-06 18:54:58.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7f0cc773ddc6bdcf464574fc7faa9216db71e09
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7f0cc773ddc6bdcf464574fc7faa9216db71e09
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add sanity checks for xinetd service restart.

xinetd.service is not installed on pre-provisioned nodes,
 so we'll add extra check for its restart.

Change-Id: I4fbac81ceb4aba534395cf8c0a842fb732559234
Closes-Bug: 1775154

[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:03.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifc418b2911ec09d1f7968ffb3d3e4093f6d07d6c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifc418b2911ec09d1f7968ffb3d3e4093f6d07d6c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

The built-in name 'file' does not exist under python 3, so replace it
with 'open', which is the same under python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ic1ff9308b1ab0bda8d49a556620bb22ca5407b5e

commit_message:
replace file() with open() for python 3 compatibility

The built-in name 'file' does not exist under python 3, so replace it
with 'open', which is the same under python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ic1ff9308b1ab0bda8d49a556620bb22ca5407b5e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-03-29 16:11:54.000000000', 'message': "Adding image membership check to _is_image_available

This adds a condition for valid membership where the image visibility is
'shared', the current project matches a member_id of the image and that
member's status is 'accepted'.  If all of these conditions are true,
then the current project has access to the image.  This check is
performed after other checks since it requires querying for membership

Change-Id: Ifdcf7c5eab435b0dc40dd3650b61ebfef1e5579e
"}, {'created': '2018-03-29 16:14:51.000000000', 'message': "Adding image membership check to _is_image_available

This adds a condition for valid membership where the image visibility is
'shared', the current project matches a member_id of the image and that
member's status is 'accepted'.  If all of these conditions are true,
then the current project has access to the image.  This check is
performed after other checks since it requires querying for membership
information from Glance so it will only affect membership checks that
were likely to fail already (due to having failed all previous checks).

Change-Id: Ifdcf7c5eab435b0dc40dd3650b61ebfef1e5579e
"}]
commit_message:
Adding image membership check to _is_image_available

This adds a condition for valid membership where the image visibility is
'shared', the current project matches a member_id of the image and that
member's status is 'accepted'.  If all of these conditions are true,
then the current project has access to the image.  This check is
performed after other checks since it requires querying for membership
information from Glance so it will only affect membership checks that
were likely to fail already (due to having failed all previous checks).

Change-Id: Ifdcf7c5eab435b0dc40dd3650b61ebfef1e5579e

commit_message:
Add gating for all supported OS for SSL

If we want to make sure that SSL is working, let's guarantee
it for all of our deployment targets.

Change-Id: Ib381d61188da8ba3788b433a17a389c6e67a73a1

commit_message:
Remove verbose output from SSL job

It makes logs more hard to read and we also don't really need it
since we rely on ARA.

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia0a27229f09467980ff4af014001febb017bb36d

commit_message:
Remove CA API policy file

The CAs API was removed some months ago [1], but this file was left
there. It generates noise when outputting the policy file.

[1] Iead0336a19ce58b8b2bb1f9af5e6dd3688fe91fc

Change-Id: I5452633e2d1de0970f2cd47c38b19f288d87db13

commit_message:
Fix GCS backup driver docs

Change If1e34ea112b0cff328a58ec2fc9c3f5a5005f1c6 renamed the Google
backup driver, but the configuration docs for the driver were not
updated. This results in the incorrect driver name being provided
for backup driver configuration and local document builds failing
due to no configuration options being found when looking for them
in the old location.

Change-Id: I40fa544892ed9ea9fb5975baeafb7c9a7e2f12a3

commit_message:
Add contributor docs on deprecating and removing compute REST APIs

Deprecating APIs with microversions is a long-established pattern
at this point, but the docs don't mention it at all, so this
adds a short description of what happens there.

We removed the os-certificates and os-cloudpipe APIs in Pike
and the os-fping API in Rocky, and there is a pattern to removal
also, so this adds detailed documentation on the steps involved
in removing a deprecated API.

Change-Id: I9fdb9ce78c45d27d3c7f55fcbda0f763dfb66d66

[{'created': '2018-05-10 19:26:59.000000000', 'message': 'Remove support for /os-fping REST API

This drops support for the fping compute REST API which
has been deprecated since Newton:

  I1a8a44530be29292561e90d6f7bd7ed512a88ee3

To match the os-cloudpipe and os-certificates removals
the os-fping controller now returns a 410 response.

The related fping_path configuration option is removed
along with the related fping policy rules.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample
test is just asserting the 410 response now.

The API sample docs are left intact since the API reference
still builds from those and can be considered more or
less branchless, so people looking at the API reference
can apply it to older deployments of nova before os-fping
was removed.

A release note is started which we can build on for each
nova-network specific API that we remove in this series.

Part of blueprint remova-nova-network

Change-Id: Ia36aaa8f74adc2b540c49523db522cd85ab17ed2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for /os-fping REST API

This drops support for the fping compute REST API which
has been deprecated since Newton:

  I1a8a44530be29292561e90d6f7bd7ed512a88ee3

To match the os-cloudpipe and os-certificates removals
the os-fping controller now returns a 410 response.

The related fping_path configuration option is removed
along with the related fping policy rules.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample
test is just asserting the 410 response now.

The API sample docs are left intact since the API reference
still builds from those and can be considered more or
less branchless, so people looking at the API reference
can apply it to older deployments of nova before os-fping
was removed.

A release note is started which we can build on for each
nova-network specific API that we remove in this series.

Part of blueprint remova-nova-network

Change-Id: Ia36aaa8f74adc2b540c49523db522cd85ab17ed2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-06 21:24:43.000000000', 'message': 'Test Django default test runner

horizon blueprint improve-horizon-testing will change
the test runner from nose to the django default test runner.

This commit is to test the django default test runner.
The verbosity is increased to check which tests are executed.

After switching the test runner, the number of tests executed
will be changed from 349 to 348. The only difference is
manila_ui.tests.test_data.utils.load_test_data which has no
actual test. nose seems to recognize this as a test based on
its filename but this is not true, so this is not a problem.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562526/
Change-Id: I5aba373dc6ad0acb6a5e14dff3799d4caf64de23

commit_message:
Test Django default test runner

horizon blueprint improve-horizon-testing will change
the test runner from nose to the django default test runner.

This commit is to test the django default test runner.
The verbosity is increased to check which tests are executed.

After switching the test runner, the number of tests executed
will be changed from 349 to 348. The only difference is
manila_ui.tests.test_data.utils.load_test_data which has no
actual test. nose seems to recognize this as a test based on
its filename but this is not true, so this is not a problem.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544296/
Change-Id: I5aba373dc6ad0acb6a5e14dff3799d4caf64de23

commit_message:
Revert "Rename fernet_utils to token_utils"

This reverts commit 03ba867327fe950d3240fdbd6d207a8c0550e2c5.

Because of the introduction of auth receipts we will be
using fernet for more than just tokens. Lets make this a
generic util for fernet key handling.

Change-Id: I3a870a63239491f84db3350178bd2313eeccdbf3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 19:47:37.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI

TODO: tests and docs

This adds a new CLI which will iterate all non-cell0
cells looking for instances that (1) have a host,
(2) aren't undergoing a task state transition and
(3) don't have allocations in placement and try
to allocate resources, based on the instance embedded
flavor, against the compute node resource provider
on which the instance is currently running.

This is meant as a way to help migrate CachingScheduler
users off the CachingScheduler by first shoring up
instance allocations in placement for any instances
created after Pike, when the nova-compute resource
tracker code stopped creating allocations in placement
since the FilterScheduler does it at the time of
scheduling (but the CachingScheduler doesn't).

There are several TODOs and NOTEs inline about things
we could build on top of this or improve, but for now
this is the basic idea.

Change-Id: Iab67fd56ab4845f8ee19ca36e7353730638efb21

commit_message:
Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI

This adds a new CLI which will iterate all non-cell0
cells looking for instances that (1) have a host,
(2) aren't undergoing a task state transition and
(3) don't have allocations in placement and try
to allocate resources, based on the instance embedded
flavor, against the compute node resource provider
on which the instance is currently running.

This is meant as a way to help migrate CachingScheduler
users off the CachingScheduler by first shoring up
instance allocations in placement for any instances
created after Pike, when the nova-compute resource
tracker code stopped creating allocations in placement
since the FilterScheduler does it at the time of
scheduling (but the CachingScheduler doesn't).

This will be useful beyond just getting deployments
off the CachingScheduler, however, since operators
will be able to use it to fix incorrect allocations
resulting from failed operations.

There are several TODOs and NOTEs inline about things
we could build on top of this or improve, but for now
this is the basic idea.

Change-Id: Iab67fd56ab4845f8ee19ca36e7353730638efb21

commit_message:
Replace rabbitmq references with oslo messaging

This removes, everywhere applicable, the reference
_rabbitmq_, replacing it with the new oslo
counterpart. Shims for compatibility are explicitly
referenced, so that we can remove them later, when
the roles have been adapted appropriately.

It explicitly puts all the oslo messaging details
in one place, as this is easier to track. It is
applied on the all group, as most of the time, the
details are used by 2 or more roles.

This also updated spice-html5 git repository URL
as their code moved out of github. This also adds
some details in job log collection in order to be
able to gather more information about failures.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572413/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572565/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560574/
Change-Id: I1bab622e22d7d820fa2f774b4df60323b1eb7d1e

subject: Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs
messages: [{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-05-24 20:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-05-25 03:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-06-06 17:38:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2018-06-06 18:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-24 20:38:59.000000000', 'message': "Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs

The ChangeLog file is generated when we run `python setup.py sdist`,
which doesn't naturally happen when we run `tox -edocs`, so on a fresh
clone the docs build will fail because it references the ChangeLog file
which isn't there. Since we don't rely on pbr any more for release notes
and we have a sophisticated release note management tool, point the docs
at the published release notes instead of the pbr ChangeLog.

Change-Id: I614091eae739154337795a8f120b68686ad0ed0a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs

The ChangeLog file is generated when we run `python setup.py sdist`,
which doesn't naturally happen when we run `tox -edocs`, so on a fresh
clone the docs build will fail because it references the ChangeLog file
which isn't there. Since we don't rely on pbr any more for release notes
and we have a sophisticated release note management tool, point the docs
at the published release notes instead of the pbr ChangeLog.

Change-Id: I614091eae739154337795a8f120b68686ad0ed0a

commit_message:
Remove references to internal PyKMIP implementation details

This change removes and replaces references to internal PyKMIP
implementation details with alternatives that support backwards
compatibility. These changes should be compliant with PyKMIP
0.7 (the current release) and PyKMIP 0.8 (the upcoming release).

Change-Id: I419680076a8eb43a98ef21474328ed8b4d267067

commit_message:
Fix node health validation with inventory changes

The inventory now uses host names in groups instead of IPs which cannot be
directly used to ping hosts in the node health validation.

The IPs are now collected from the meta hostvars dictionary.

Change-Id: I75f3dcd5e29ae26fdc65ef093f8c207163ed1fff

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-06 20:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-06 20:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2\n\nAlready in progress.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-06 20:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:06:36.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia4382a110fbfb61c86157088ea31bd55c8bcbc53
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia4382a110fbfb61c86157088ea31bd55c8bcbc53
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Correct usage of transport_url in example

The example usage of transport_url in ConfFixture was not corrected when
the rest of the code was switched to using 'fake:/' for transport_url.
Since other projects will refer to this example to review changes, it
should be correct.

Also change the transport URLs used in test_transport to correspond to
the correct way of specifying virtual hosts.

Change-Id: If8e0a869e02fda2d8d2c86d82ef83ffc3a4361e4

commit_message:
Add warning output if failed to rebuild exception when deserialize

In some specific cases, the middleware would fail to rebuild
the original exception, see bug [1] below. Adding this output
may help locate the root cause quickly.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1728826

Change-Id: Ia9304bda4e515812b146885f830e70f28a285f2d

commit_message:
Revert "Add Zuulv3 jobs for puppet functional testing"

This reverts commit 0474b75e86fe8ade257bfea9b92cab9aed6ada1f.

Since the general consensus is to just keep puppet on life support
until we're ready for a new config management system, it's not
worth the effort to convert our beaker-rspec tests to a new thing.

Change-Id: I275443442ced5c76ec016b66b957bee28dea40dc

commit_message:
Replace neutron ovsfw job with iptables_hybrid

In patch [1] neutron-tempest-ovsfw job was switched to be
neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid job as openvswitch firewall is
now set as default fw driver by devstack.
So we need to update our grafana dashboard according to this
change.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571692/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571692/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-29 12:56:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add optional support for retrying certain HTTP codes

Ironic commonly returns HTTP 409 when a node is locked by another routine
and HTTP 503 when the conductor has no free threads to process the request.
Currently it is managed by custom code in ironicclient and openstacksdk,
this change will allow to move it to Session itself.

Change-Id: I04e356e7856b020cd20aa598e291ef31e02730d2
'}]
commit_message:
Add optional support for retrying certain HTTP codes

Ironic commonly returns HTTP 409 when a node is locked by another routine
and HTTP 503 when the conductor has no free threads to process the request.
Currently it is managed by custom code in ironicclient and openstacksdk,
this change will allow to move it to Session itself.

Change-Id: I04e356e7856b020cd20aa598e291ef31e02730d2

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 18:51:07.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib71942ec6f5e9f55d6a1f151c0e97b657167905d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-06 18:54:39.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib71942ec6f5e9f55d6a1f151c0e97b657167905d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib71942ec6f5e9f55d6a1f151c0e97b657167905d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add flag to enable QoS DSCP marking in ODL

In OpenDaylight, a config parameter is available to enable DSCP
marking inheritance for packets egressing out of OVS through
VXLAN/GRE tunnels.

Add a flag in TripleO to enable this parameter via puppet-opendaylight.

Change-Id: I3b192c8fc1bc92c1124d3b27c60ad5c0c4dd42f9
(cherry picked from commit bdd51e937ac81d789c50b0569cafde1d134632f8)

commit_message:
Add glance-eventlet-ssl-handshake-broken-py35 job

Blacklist the two currently skipped functional-py35 tests and
include them in a new non-voting job so that their failure is
obvious instead of hidden.

Change-Id: Ice8e114c6590b25f3ec79fbe4c06efaa245706c0
Partial-bug: #1769006

If the TaskServer RPC service is not started before the launcher waits
for its completion, then on shutdown it could result in a hang:

    WARNING oslo_messaging.server Possible hang: stop is waiting for start to complete

commit_message:
Start task RPC service before waiting

If the TaskServer RPC service is not started before the launcher waits
for its completion, then on shutdown it could result in a hang:

    WARNING oslo_messaging.server Possible hang: stop is waiting for start to complete

This is a port of the fix for Sahara bug #1546119.

Change-Id: I083a85c2ff53364535ac8658677ffa69f4318593
Closes-bug: #1705543

messages:
[{'account_id': 22959, 'date': '2018-01-08 09:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22959, 'date': '2018-01-08 09:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2018-01-08 17:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)

Does the current implementation result in duplicate tables if a table (e.g., transport_keys) already exists? Do we know that alembic.op.create_table() does not already check if a table exists before trying to create a new one?'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2018-01-08 17:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 22959, 'date': '2018-01-09 01:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 22959, 'date': '2018-01-09 01:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > Does the current implementation result in duplicate tables if a
 > table (e.g., transport_keys) already exists? Do we know that
 > alembic.op.create_table() does not already check if a table exists
 > before trying to create a new one?

thanks for review, I have modified it'}, {'account_id': 22959, 'date': '2018-01-09 01:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 22959, 'date': '2018-01-09 01:46:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > Does the current implementation result in duplicate tables if a
 > table (e.g., transport_keys) already exists? Do we know that
 > alembic.op.create_table() does not already check if a table exists
 > before trying to create a new one?

Sometime, when barbican service starts, database tables create repeatedly although table already exists
So we'd better add some judgement in database upgrade script"}, {'account_id': 22959, 'date': '2018-01-09 06:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24711, 'date': '2018-01-09 18:12:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

> Sometime, when barbican service starts, database tables create repeatedly although table already exists. So we'd better add some judgement in database upgrade script

I see. From a code functionality standpoint, this looks good, and definitely saves some time if a table already exist. Though I'm still unclear if the attached bug is actually an error or a warning. In other words, does this error break barbican? Or is the old 'orders' table just used instead of creating a new one?"}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2018-06-06 18:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning patch due to lack of activity for months.  Feel free to re-submit if needed.'}]

commit_message:
Add table_exists in database upgrade script

Before creating tables in database, we should add table_exists in script
if table does not exist, start creating

Change-Id: Ic06a591e0337349a8fd0c6f88732310bbb5c3fc0
Closes-Bug: #1742019

If you want to add the name of ForeignKey, I think you have to create new files by using "barbican-db-manage revision" and append your code to do this. 
   In case of upgrade from O -> master (Pike), these change will not be affect to database.
=> And I think we should not to change this, it is not necessary.'}, {'account_id': 19283, 'date': '2017-05-16 23:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> If you want to add the name of ForeignKey, I think you have to
 > create new files by using "barbican-db-manage revision" and append
 > your code to do this.
 > In case of upgrade from O -> master (Pike), these change will not
 > be affect to database.
 > => And I think we should not to change this, it is not necessary.

Hi Nam, unfortunately if we want these to work across different MySQL engines we'll have to specify the names upfront or change the logic in the other scripts to select the foreign keys based on their configuration (table, column). The other scripts are assuming auto-generated names from InnoDB. What I've done is to specify those names upfront so that it'll work with InnoDB and NDB. We can't do this as a revision because the alembic scripts will fail later when the foreign keys are dropped and recreated. The other option is to add more lines of code to the other scripts to find the name of the foreign key and preserve it through the drop and recreate cycles. Adding the names upfront is simple and doesn't negatively impact anything.'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2017-05-17 10:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

that call they are doing is local to the pysqlite driver for SQLite.  I'm not sure of the codepaths here, but Barbican should not be calling that on database connections unconditionally.  additionally, oslo.db already has hooks to set the FK pragma on for SQLite, so barbican also doesn't even need to be doing this if they use the oslo.db hooks appropriately (but I'm not sure if they are not using oslo.db *at all* in the main API, or if they just have old patterns in use.  haven't looked)"}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-05-19 18:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

the fact that PyMySQL also is not in their test-requirements indicates that barbican simply doesn't run their test suite against non-SQLite databases (which is strange, because the migration "walk versions" tests only run against MySQL and Postgresql).'}, {'account_id': 19283, 'date': '2017-05-19 19:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> the fact that PyMySQL also is not in their test-requirements
 > indicates that barbican simply doesn't run their test suite against
 > non-SQLite databases (which is strange, because the migration "walk
 > versions" tests only run against MySQL and Postgresql).

Agreed, I was just looking at the repositories.py module and barbican is definitely using the older methods and even copied the code from nova for retries. Looks like this will require fixing everything to use the oslo_db enginefacade and then look at the database_utils.py module and anything else built around it. commit_message:
Use oslo.db options for database sync and upgrade

Enables oslo.db optionsfor barbican-db-manage. Also fixes
foreign key constraint names on initial creation so that
migrations work with both InnoDB and MySQL Cluster (NDB).

Change-Id: I69a8cfd812cec72531aa0a94bf719eeaf92beac6
Depends-On: I9f1fd2a87fdf75332de2339d3ff4f08ce9220dcf

commit_message:
OpenStack cloud driver added

This change introduces OpenStack cloud driver based
on the openstacksdk. The goal is to interface the Redfish
server to the OpenStack-managed nodes (e.g. virtual
baremetal nodes).

Documentation for this change comes with patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523445/

Story: 1741052
Task: 12048
Change-Id: Iaed42435c27c8624c6a1a24ef886f7a0ec0937ea

[{'account_id': 26910, 'date': '2017-09-24 23:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-09-24 23:45:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-25 00:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Dev environment setup now requires the setting up of an authentication
environement (e.g. Keystone). Improved the dev env set up doc to show
how to check a fresh install for success, with and without the authentication

commit_message:
Dev env setup docs improved for auth setup.

Dev environment setup now requires the setting up of an authentication
environement (e.g. Keystone). Improved the dev env set up doc to show
how to check a fresh install for success, with and without the authentication
enabled.

Change-Id: Id3198090d8f7ba16de82d944e5c7f499c6558115

subject: Fix enable list project_id in secrets

commit_message:
add ipavault plugin

We are adding a new secret store plugin to integrate with
IPA Vault rather than going to the KRA directly.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iffeaa64ff24172387d8df64638c077aed4d80b4b

commit_message:
Adding a plugin for Hashicorp Vault

With patch >=6 this actually works with Barbican in Devstack
Where "works" = Correctly stores and retreives key material
in Hashicorp Vault.

Still needs secret generation and of course tests.

Change-Id: Iff70a8de35522d510f16af6436d5d34700d31f08

commit_message:
Adding Tests to Project Quota Management by Serv Admin User

The User with the service admin role in barbican should be able to
successfully GET, SET and DELETE Project Quotas of other tenant id
or project ids. These tests are missing in the functional tests
since the current tests only check the features executed by
by same user and not by the service admin user.

Change-Id: I8785b121a0682ad0ccb1124814392ed1f841c6fa

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.
see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446762/ for the reason.

Change-Id: I24389a80491328f4aa2b1e50e8c1e4b0bfb82e19
Depends-On: I7d3bd59cf95d9e10c2d578b63dc60313f1d09282

commit_message:
Added tempest.test_plugins to barbican setup.cfg

Tempest plugin containing tests used to verify
the functionality of a barbican installation.
The barbican_tempest_plugin tests the barbican quota API,
which requires the existence of the 'key-manager:service-admin'
role in barbican.

Change-Id: I6251bcbbe37362bfd7f494c514b2b39f852bbce0

commit_message:
Add guru meditation report for barbican

Oslo_reports enables OpenStack projects to dump Guru Meditation
Reports with useful debugging information to files or stderr.
So we introduce it into barbican.

Change-Id: Ibe1323a27b27bfdc2cecb24429e2197b0cd67e54

commit_message:
Use 'project' instead of 'tenant' when switching to openstackclient
command

We tend to use 'project' rather than 'tenant' when switching to
openstackclient command, such as:

  openstack role add --user <user> --project <project> <role>

Change-Id: I0b6b15531486a471bbb4b0da6957203e4641d3cf

commit_message:
Sub pycrypto with cryptography in dogtag

pycrypto is no longer maintained [1]. This patch rewrites functions
using pycrypto and replaces them with the cryptography equivalent for
the dogtag plugin

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568

Change-Id: Ic230356385f837c19e0d031bfb40e811a1ecef4d

commit_message:
Add api documentation for transport keys

This patch adds api documentation for transport keys. It also
provides documentation on how to add a transport key to a
Secret.

Change-Id: I7307c135a9e1c92a69d8d97c66f9374e2e33b51c
Closes-Bug: #1459783

commit_message:
WIP: PKCS11 key generation: Add CKM_GENERIC_KEY for generate HMAC

Barbican currently uses the key type AES for HMAC signing, while
the pkcs11 standard v2.40 specifies GENERIC SECRET [1].
This causes key signing to fail.

This patch allows the user to select between AES an GENERIC SECRET
during HMAC generation using pkcs11_key_generation.py

TODO:
- Should both types still
- add functionality to barbican_manage.py

[1] http://docs.oasis-open.org/pkcs11/pkcs11-curr/v2.40/os/pkcs11-curr-v2.40-os.pdf
p.69

Partial-Bug: #1704141

Change-Id: I4172bc54e6f29419155e3ac0ce78c6d0d1b6eaf3

commit_message:
WIP: PKCS11: Add CKM_GENERIC_SECRET

Barbican currently uses the key type AES for HMAC signing, while
the pkcs11 standard v2.40 specifies GENERIC SECRET [1].
This causes key signing to fail.

This patch introduces GENERIC SECRET to p11 crypto and pkcs11,
while maintaining compatibility with the existing AES implementation.

TODO:
- Should both types still be supported?

[1] http://docs.oasis-open.org/pkcs11/pkcs11-curr/v2.40/os/pkcs11-curr-v2.40-os.pdf
p.69

Partial-Bug: #1704141

Change-Id: I00089fe08f4533b8ce0de42ee553af6838c7c78d

[{'created': '2017-07-13 13:22:39.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: PKCS11: Use correct attributes for key unwrapping

Setting the attribute CKA_EXTRACTABLE manually for key unwrapping results in
CKR_ATTRIBUTE_READ_ONLY error. This error occurs due because that CKA_EXTRACTABLE
is already set by PKCS#11 automatically, as specified in the PKCS11 standard.

"The CKA_EXTRACTABLE attribute is by default set to CK_TRUE." [1]

[1] http://docs.oasis-open.org/pkcs11/pkcs11-base/v2.40/os/pkcs11-base-v2.40-os.pdf
p. 132 - Section 5.13

Closed-Bug: #1704128

Change-Id: I41aebde9db072850f082af68ae543b7c4a898e68
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: PKCS11: Use correct attributes for key unwrapping

Setting the attribute CKA_EXTRACTABLE manually for key unwrapping results in
CKR_ATTRIBUTE_READ_ONLY error. This error occurs due because that CKA_EXTRACTABLE
is already set by PKCS#11 automatically, as specified in the PKCS11 standard.

"The CKA_EXTRACTABLE attribute is by default set to CK_TRUE." [1]

[1] http://docs.oasis-open.org/pkcs11/pkcs11-base/v2.40/os/pkcs11-base-v2.40-os.pdf
p. 132 - Section 5.13

commit_message:
WIP: Use correct AES_GCM header in pkcs11

Currently barbican specifices its AES_GCM header based on the pkcs11
v2.40 draft [2] but it should be the header of pkcs11
v2.40 final [1].
This causes the error: CKR_MECHANISM_PARAM_INVALID mechanism length invalid
(expected 40, provided 48) as reported in Barbican bug #1613989 [3].

The draft specifies the variable CK_ULONG ulIvBits;
while the current version of 2.40 does not.

[1] http://docs.oasis-open.org/pkcs11/pkcs11-curr/v2.40/os/pkcs11-curr-v2.40-os.pdf
p. 80 - section 2.12.3
[2] https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/document.php?document_id=55657&wg_abbrev=pkcs11
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/barbican/+bug/1613989

Closes-Bug: #1613989

Change-Id: Ia4b4c59466dbe91f84a3992dc7cb9761b4818004

commit_message:
Add granular placement policy rules for aggregates

This adds the policy rules for the resource provider
aggregates GET and PUT APIs.

Note that this change also uses scope types, which are
not enforced by default (see the [oslo_policy]/enforce_scope
configuration option).

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I2ffb8a8f1464381d7bfb1b81fb40a4689b0c80ea

Will this patch serves it's purpose. We have decided to take a different approach into it that hopefully Michael will follow up upon"}, {'account_id': 19673, 'date': '2016-04-28 15:33:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 19673, 'date': '2016-04-28 15:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

As discussed in the Austin summit design session:

"Orders should not have a quota.  Instead, orders should be accepted and the X amount of secrets to be created should be reserved and the reserved secret should count against the secret quota.  Extra awesome: Some orders also create Containers, so we may need to check the Container quota as well. Upon Order completion, the secret quota should be checked.  If creating the new secret puts you over the quota then the order should go into an ERROR state.
Check secret limit when Order is placed
Check secret limit again before calling the plugin to generate the secret
Check secret limit again when plugin returns the secret before storing it"'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2017-02-23 19:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Michael,

We would like to fix this bug for the pike-1 release.  Are you still interested in developing this bugfix or should we assign this to someone else?

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2018-06-06 18:31:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning patch due to no activity in well over a year.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-10 21:49:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Order Quota Enforcement to Account For Secrets Quota

Currently, if secrets quota is not infinite, it is possible to create
(secrets quota + orders quota) number of secrets via order creation,
because order quota enforcer does not take into account whether the
secrets quota is full or not.

This fix enforces the secrets quota in addition to the orders quota when
creating an order.

Now, it will not be possible to create > secrets quota number of secrets
through order creation.

Change-Id: I003bac2514632b7e01d54bf93e036bbb7d5849cf
Closes-Bug: #1535404
'}, {'created': '2016-03-12 01:01:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Order Quota Enforcement to Account For Secrets Quota

Currently, if secrets quota is not infinite, it is possible to create
(secrets quota + orders quota) number of secrets via order creation,
because order quota enforcer does not take into account whether the
secrets quota is full or not.

This fix enforces the secrets quota in addition to the orders quota when
creating an order.

Now, it will not be possible for an order to create more secrets if secrets
have already met their quotas.

In the near future, a more definite policy needs to be defined for the case
where an order is created when the secrets quota is full and orders quota is
not full.

Change-Id: I003bac2514632b7e01d54bf93e036bbb7d5849cf
Closes-Bug: #1535404
'}, {'created': '2016-04-11 19:49:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Order Quota Enforcement to Account For Secrets Quota

Currently, if secrets quota is not infinite, it is possible to create
(secrets quota + orders quota) number of secrets via order creation,
because order quota enforcer does not take into account whether the
secrets quota is full or not.

This fix enforces the secrets quota in addition to the orders quota when
creating an order.

Now, it will not be possible for an order to create more secrets if secrets
have already met their quotas.

In the near future, a more definite policy needs to be defined for the case
where an order is created when the secrets quota is full and orders quota is
not full.

Change-Id: I003bac2514632b7e01d54bf93e036bbb7d5849cf

commit_message:
Fix Order Quota Enforcement to Account For Secrets Quota

Currently, if secrets quota is not infinite, it is possible to create
(secrets quota + orders quota) number of secrets via order creation,
because order quota enforcer does not take into account whether the
secrets quota is full or not.

This fix enforces the secrets quota in addition to the orders quota when
creating an order.

Now, it will not be possible for an order to create more secrets if secrets
have already met their quotas.

In the near future, a more definite policy needs to be defined for the case
where an order is created when the secrets quota is full and orders quota is
not full.

Change-Id: I003bac2514632b7e01d54bf93e036bbb7d5849cf
Closes-Bug: #1535404

commit_message:
Remove functional-identity-v3-only job

The glanceclient-dsvm-functional-identity-v3-only job is exactly
like the glanceclient-dsvm-functional job, except that it sets
the devstack config option ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2 to False.  Change
I5afcba6321f496b8170be27789bee7c9ad8eacce in devstack makes False
the default value for this option, so we already have a voting gate
job that uses identity v3.  This patch removes the redundant
non-voting identity-v3-only job.

Change-Id: I5d5550c06b179810d25a472cc423403daed43776

commit_message:
Fix Git URL for SPICE to work with CentOS

It looks like CentOS does not currently pull things properly if
the trailing .git is not there, this patch adds it so that builds
and deploys with CentOS work.

commit_message:
Fix Git URL for SPICE to work with CentOS

It looks like CentOS does not currently pull things properly if
the trailing .git is not there, this patch adds it so that builds
and deploys with CentOS work.

Change-Id: Iab6ffe67338695d13c287172f532624a2a569664

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 20:53:59.000000000', 'message': "Use ksa session for cinder microversion check

[1] added a method to validate availability of a desired version of the
cinder API.  This method called into
cinderclient.client.get_highest_client_server_version to
(unsurprisingly) discover the highest available version to compare
against.  However, that routine uses a raw requests.get to access the
version document from the server.  This breaks when the endpoint URL is
using HTTPS, because nothing sets up the cert info for that call.

With this change, we work around the issue by duplicating the logic from
get_highest_client_server_version, but doing the version discovery via
the same keystoneauth1 session that's configured for use with the client
itself, thus inheriting any SSL configuration as appropriate.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/469579/

Change-Id: I4de355195281009a5979710d7f14ae8ea11d10e0
Closes-Bug: #1752152

commit_message:
Use ksa session for cinder microversion check

[1] added a method to validate availability of a desired version of the
cinder API.  This method called into
cinderclient.client.get_highest_client_server_version to
(unsurprisingly) discover the highest available version to compare
against.  However, that routine uses a raw requests.get to access the
version document from the server.  This breaks when the endpoint URL is
using HTTPS, because nothing sets up the cert info for that call.

With this change, we work around the issue by duplicating the logic from
get_highest_client_server_version, but doing the version discovery via
the same keystoneauth1 session that's configured for use with the client
itself, thus inheriting any SSL configuration as appropriate.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/469579/

Change-Id: I4de355195281009a5979710d7f14ae8ea11d10e0
Closes-Bug: #1752152

commit_message:
vars: Do not pull devel packages on distro installations

The devel packages are only needed to build the pip pacakges so we don't
need them when we install packages straight from the distro repos.

Change-Id: I84bb4c07d2a2abdf517ba24477c2b22a32564129
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Completely stop using the "fake" classic driver in unit tests

This change makes "fake-hardware" the default driver for test nodes
and makes enabled_drivers empty in the base test class.

Note that some unit test coverage for classic drivers is lost because
of this change. It is fine, because the classic drivers themselves
are deprecated and will be removed soon.

Change-Id: I06acb5aed24ef952db3f9e6987e5a90c81e96401

commit_message:
Fix the title in index.rst

The titles in the index.rst can't be shown in the webpage.
This patch adds them back.

Change-Id: I56febf6cb137b7f6dbc05365d48159be36d18c13

subject: Make timezone-aware configurable
messages:
[{'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2017-09-08 22:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-09 01:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-oslo.versionedobjects-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/89/502189/1/check/gate-oslo.versionedobjects-docs-ubuntu-xenial/e30f5a1//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 43s
- gate-oslo.versionedobjects-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/89/502189/1/check/gate-oslo.versionedobjects-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/97523eb/ : SUCCESS in 4m 47s
- gate-oslo.versionedobjects-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/89/502189/1/check/gate-oslo.versionedobjects-python27-ubuntu-xenial/03917c8/ : SUCCESS in 3m 32s
- gate-oslo.versionedobjects-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/89/502189/1/check/gate-oslo.versionedobjects-python35/7f5cbfd/ : SUCCESS in 4m 08s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.versionedobjects-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/89/502189/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.versionedobjects-ubuntu-xenial/6cb3a28/ : SUCCESS in 1h 27m 24s
- gate-oslo.versionedobjects-src-grenade-dsvm-multinode-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/89/502189/1/check/gate-oslo.versionedobjects-src-grenade-dsvm-multinode-ubuntu-xenial-nv/9adcc55/ : SUCCESS in 1h 00m 36s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-09-11 17:48:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

if the goal here is that we move towards *never* storing TZ information in the database, then I am on board.  There is no reason to store TZ info in the database as embedded with the time information itself, and it only leads to problems.   timestamps in a DB should always be UTC only and never anything else.

to the degree that this patch is trying to keep it open-ended as a feature, and not an interim measure to be eventually locked down, I'm -1 on that."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2017-09-11 18:14:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, I agree. I guess this is something the TC will need to impose?

Meanwhile, how about let's document the fact that this is NOT a feature. Rather, it is temporary measure to allow applications time to standardize on UTC. Should we set a grace period of, say +2 releases, for this option to be removed?"}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-09-11 18:34:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure whether or not actually locking down and removing TZ-aware capability in a fixed number of releases is feasible, since if a project stores TZ aware timestamps, that's a data migration to fix it, and it might not be worth fixing for them for a long time.   

The API change that would be pursued is that UTC-only becomes the *default* within +2 releases, and projects that have already built on TZ-aware will need to have the flag set to False by then.  The False value would be documented as legacy.

sure as long as we state the intent that hey, you are relying on timezone-aware timestamps, we"}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-09-11 18:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-08 22:00:14.000000000', 'message': "Make timezone-aware configurable

Some databases such as mysql does not store timezone information in its
DateTime columns. It require applications to canonicalize the timezone
of the datetime object to UTC prior to storing it into the database. Though
oslo_versionedobjects' DateTimeField class offers a tzinfo_aware parameter
to let the application whether they want timezone informaiton or not. That
puts a burden on every application who integrates with oslo_versionedobjects
to funnel that information all the way through from their respective
configuration files. Furthermore, timezone-aware is database-specific, not
field-specific so this information should be globally applicable.

Since oslo_versionedobjects is layered between the DB objecs and application
data models, it is sensical to expose a global config option to specify
whether the DateTimeField should be timezone-aware, or not.

This change introduces a configuration option 'timezone_aware' in the
'oslo_versionedobjects' section to allow applications to specify whether they
want the underlaying datetime data to be timezone aware of not. This option,
if present, will override value specified in the 'tzinfo_aware' parameter.

Change-Id: Id490587a12b776847716a397cd5d5ef29d1b6409
Closes-Bug: #1696417
"}, {'created': '2017-09-12 23:31:32.000000000', 'message': 'Make timezone-aware configurable

to let the application whether they want timezone informaiton or not. That
puts a burden on every application who integrates with oslo_versionedobjects
to funnel that information all the way through from their respective
configuration files. Furthermore, timezone-aware is database-specific, not
field-specific so this information should be globally applicable.

Since oslo_versionedobjects is layered between the DB objecs and application
data models, it is sensical to expose a global config option to specify
whether the DateTimeField should be timezone-aware, or not.

This change introduces a configuration option 'timezone_aware' in the
'oslo_versionedobjects' section to allow applications to specify whether they
want the underlaying datetime data to be timezone aware of not. This option,
if present, will override value specified in the 'tzinfo_aware' parameter.

In general, it is rather painful to deal with timezone-aware data in the
database, especially since OpenStack services support varity of database
provider. Therefore, we strongly recommend application to start migrating
and standardizing datetime data to UTC and drop the timezone awareness. This
option is designed to help legacy applications to maintain backward
compatibility only. It will default to "False" in the future OpenStack S
release. From OpenStack S release and beyond, legacy applications, or
masochists,  must explicity set this value to "True" if they wish to continue
to support timezone-aware data in the database.

commit_message:
Make timezone-aware configurable

Some databases such as mysql does not store timezone information in its
DateTime columns. It require applications to canonicalize the timezone
of the datetime object to UTC prior to storing it into the database. Though
oslo_versionedobjects' DateTimeField class offers a tzinfo_aware parameter
to let the application whether they want timezone informaiton or not. That
puts a burden on every application who integrates with oslo_versionedobjects
to funnel that information all the way through from their respective
configuration files. Furthermore, timezone-aware is database-specific, not
field-specific so this information should be globally applicable.

Since oslo_versionedobjects is layered between the DB objecs and application
data models, it is sensical to expose a global config option to specify
whether the DateTimeField should be timezone-aware, or not.

This change introduces a configuration option 'timezone_aware' in the
'oslo_versionedobjects' section to allow applications to specify whether they
want the underlaying datetime data to be timezone aware of not. This option,
if present, will override value specified in the 'tzinfo_aware' parameter.

In general, it is rather painful to deal with timezone-aware data in the
database, especially since OpenStack services support varity of database
provider. Therefore, we strongly recommend application to start migrating
and standardizing datetime data to UTC and drop the timezone awareness. This
option is designed to help legacy applications to maintain backward
compatibility only. It will default to "False" in the future OpenStack S
release. From OpenStack S release and beyond, legacy applications, or
masochists,  must explicity set this value to "True" if they wish to continue
to support timezone-aware data in the database.

Change-Id: Id490587a12b776847716a397cd5d5ef29d1b6409
Closes-Bug: #1696417

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 16:23:42.000000000', 'message': "Improve error reporting for enable-ssh-admin.sh

When enable-ssh-admin.sh fails, the error message output is very
unhelpful for figuring out what actually happened.  It seems the
problem is that the info log level is off by default in tripleoclient,
so the log line has no effect unless --debug is also passed.  This
is particularly problematic for enable-ssh-admin.sh, however,
because it can fail intermittently (as described in the attached
bug).  This means that a subsequent run with --debug enabled may
succeed and the underlying problem won't be discovered.

To address this, the log.info call is changed to a plain print like
the other tripleoclient messages that get logged during a deployment,
and the return code is included in the exception message in case that
is helpful for determining what happened.

Change-Id: Id73467a49d750a8748bea7efc2a83bd753f681d1
Partial-Bug: 1766924
"}]
commit_message:
Improve error reporting for enable-ssh-admin.sh

When enable-ssh-admin.sh fails, the error message output is very
unhelpful for figuring out what actually happened.  It seems the
problem is that the info log level is off by default in tripleoclient,
so the log line has no effect unless --debug is also passed.  This
is particularly problematic for enable-ssh-admin.sh, however,
because it can fail intermittently (as described in the attached
bug).  This means that a subsequent run with --debug enabled may
succeed and the underlying problem won't be discovered.

To address this, the log.info call is changed to a plain print like
the other tripleoclient messages that get logged during a deployment,
and the return code is included in the exception message in case that
is helpful for determining what happened.

Change-Id: Id73467a49d750a8748bea7efc2a83bd753f681d1
Partial-Bug: 1766924

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints in integration tests

If we don't pass -c [upper-constraints] to the commands that deal
with requirements we don't get protection from broken deps.

Change-Id: If47a891077555f4a3a5763a3ff68faef3aa0fa47

commit_message:
Added support of volume api_v3 client

* From rocky release projects are consuming the volume featured
  enabled v3 API, Since the earlier code has support
  for v1, v2 and since api_v3 is used in tempest.conf, it will give
  AttributeError: 'Manager' object has no attribute 'volumes_client'.
  The above patch fixes the issue.

* Keep cinder v1 api as tempest plugin is branchless, it would avoid
  breakage if someone is still consuming it.

Closes-Bug: #1775353

Change-Id: Ia9d070a6033a8192112dbaa1704b1de6838051c5

commit_message:
Use generic metadata term instead of config drive

Metadata can be consumed from metadata service and configuration drive.
The spec should refer to the generic metadata term so both mechanisms
are implied.

blueprint multiple-fixed-ips-network-information

Change-Id: If877de77793d5be35ddd2ffc41c7817760b67bfb

commit_message:
Remove old OpenDaylight build references

Versions that have been marked as EOL and are no longer distributed
through the regular channels. There is no longer a need to maintain
them.

This patch removes all references to these old builds.

Change-Id: Ib395c6bec1dea341da712fafc0a566cca9350b95

commit_message:
Remove nitrogen references as it is EOL

Nitrogen has been marked as EOL and is no longer distributed through the
regular channels. There is no longer a need to maintain it.

This patch removes all references to nitrogen from the repo, except one
related to granade that will need to be resolved with another patch.

Change-Id: Iba29b2a5c3c3a13a611ef76b897d93a1e60430a4

commit_message:
Added example blogposts

The usage of privsep isn't really clear nor easy - adding examples
is a good way to avoid bad practices, especially since those two
entries actually provide hints for a common, clean way to use this
library.

Thumb up to Mike Carden for those precious links.

Change-Id: If051ef284ad06aaf44a5eb81242b90af31fdcc06

commit_message:
Add keystone credential-keys and fernet-keys clarification when restoring the Undercloud

We need to be sure that when puppet configures the Undercloud we reuse the keys in the
folders credential-keys and fernet-keys.

Otherwise we will have keystone issues.

Change-Id: Ib9274f28e9163753821abd7b430b2b1117aac622
