revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-04 09:38:08.000000000', 'message': "Add a 'trash_output' flag to ansible playbook action

Sometimes, the output is REALLY big. It ends up throwing an error in
MySQL trying to write to the output of the ActionExecution to the
database. Since we're passing the output back via zaqar, we can
just throw this away.

The trash_output flag defaults to false, to maintain the original
behavior.

Change-Id: Id13c7cf52b306891d780243b2562c8ca305aa365
Closes-Bug: #1768913
(cherry picked from commit 89986793a8c3bff9be28cc674923b9f30eab1e89)
"}]
commit_message:
Add a 'trash_output' flag to ansible playbook action

Sometimes, the output is REALLY big. It ends up throwing an error in
MySQL trying to write to the output of the ActionExecution to the
database. Since we're passing the output back via zaqar, we can
just throw this away.

The trash_output flag defaults to false, to maintain the original
behavior.

Change-Id: Id13c7cf52b306891d780243b2562c8ca305aa365
Closes-Bug: #1768913
(cherry picked from commit 89986793a8c3bff9be28cc674923b9f30eab1e89)

FWIW, we shouldn't technically have to maintain backward compatibility with the existing ip_address field since this is a versioned change, but anything asking for the "latest" version and assuming the key is there would be broken, although anything relying on the 'latest' version instead of pinning to a version it knows about is bad design - that would be like setting your tooling to always hit the compute 2.latest microversion which would constantly break you.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-06-06 13:54:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

'}, {'created': '2016-09-30 19:04:34.000000000', 'message': 'Multiple Fixed-IPs support in network information

Introduce support for multiple fixed-ips in network information found
in metadata service. Network information currently only considers
the first fixed-ip even if instance has more than one fixed-ip per port.

NOTE: The current and proposed formats do not fully address multiple subnets.

Each subnet can have its own routes and default route which create challenges:
* Should all routes be merged in the same "routes" attribute?
* What should be the default route if more than one subnet provides
  a default route? Should we provide all of them?
* What should be the implementation logic an in-guest agent
  use to determine the default route?
* Are there use cases where one default route should be used over the others?
  I'm thinking about NFV or other specialized use cases.

blueprint multiple-fixed-ips-network-information

Change-Id: I135e40edc8850d1dfb352f6b7abd841a4f516888

commit_message:
Multiple Fixed-IPs support in network information

Introduce support for multiple fixed-ips in network information found
in metadata service. Network information currently only considers
the first fixed-ip even if instance has more than one fixed-ip per port.

NOTE: The current and proposed formats do not fully address multiple subnets.

Each subnet can have its own routes and default route which create challenges:
* Should all routes be merged in the same "routes" attribute?
* What should be the default route if more than one subnet provides
  a default route? Should we provide all of them?
* What should be the implementation logic an in-guest agent
  use to determine the default route?
* Are there use cases where one default route should be used over the others?
  I'm thinking about NFV or other specialized use cases.

blueprint multiple-fixed-ips-network-information

Change-Id: I135e40edc8850d1dfb352f6b7abd841a4f516888

commit_message:
documentation on simulators added

This change re-arranges the documentation along the lines
adopted at OpenStack and also adds some basic hints on
Redfish simulators configuration and use.

Additionally, the sphinx docs building jobs is configured to the
project.

Change-Id: I7ec295d542f003555a1bbf227853936f53966f42

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 21:51:01.000000000', 'message': 'Mark a fullstack test unstable.

Recently fullstack jobs started showing failures because of two
tests. One was security_groups were not getting applied before it
started testing connectivity b/w instances which is addressed by [1].
Second failure is test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost which
is getting debbuged and right now fullstack jobs is unstable because
of that. This patch marks that test unstable for now to avoid rechecks and
load on CI.

[1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572295/

Change-Id: Ib0cc17b8d5aa5366a7478b301d70aa99841dc873
Related-Bug: #1775183
'}]
commit_message:
Mark a fullstack test unstable.

Recently fullstack jobs started showing failures because of two
tests. One was security_groups were not getting applied before it
started testing connectivity b/w instances which is addressed by [1].
Second failure is test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost which
is getting debbuged and right now fullstack jobs is unstable because
of that. This patch marks that test unstable for now to avoid rechecks and
load on CI.

[1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572295/

Change-Id: Ib0cc17b8d5aa5366a7478b301d70aa99841dc873
Related-Bug: #1775183

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-30 08:42:30.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: add support for live migration

This is a proposal for adding support for live migration in the VMware
driver. When the VMware driver is used, each nova-compute is managing a
single vCenter cluster. For the purposes of this proposal we assume that
all nova-computes are managing clusters under the same vCenter server.

blueprint vmware-live-migration

Change-Id: I726b22fb92aedb50a25a3ca38ba92048f05f2a17
'}, {'created': '2016-04-04 08:02:09.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: add support for live migration

This is a proposal for adding support for live migration in the VMware
driver. When the VMware driver is used, each nova-compute is managing a
single vCenter cluster. For the purposes of this proposal we assume that
all nova-computes are managing clusters under the same vCenter server.
Migrating instances across vCenters is supported starting from vSphere
6.0. We can add support for this as a next-step after this blueprint is
implemented.

blueprint vmware-live-migration

Change-Id: I726b22fb92aedb50a25a3ca38ba92048f05f2a17

commit_message:
VMware: add support for live migration

This is a proposal for adding support for live migration in the VMware
driver. When the VMware driver is used, each nova-compute is managing a
single vCenter cluster. For the purposes of this proposal we assume that
all nova-computes are managing clusters under the same vCenter server.
Migrating instances across vCenters is supported starting from vSphere
6.0. We can add support for this as a next-step after this blueprint is
implemented.

blueprint vmware-live-migration

Change-Id: I726b22fb92aedb50a25a3ca38ba92048f05f2a17

[{'created': '2018-05-31 16:13:24.000000000', 'message': "Updated RBAC test cases for cinder

1) test_encryption_types_rbac.py
   Use granular rule volume_extension:volume_type_encryption_create/delete/update
   for the corresponding create/delete/update volume_type_encryption test cases.

2) test_volume_metadata_rbac.py
   Add logic to check for 'volume_image_metadata' attribute in the response as the
   server will still respond with 200 if the user does not have the permission to
   perform the action. The difference will be the present or not present of the

3) test_volume_basic_crud_rbac.py

   test_volume_list_image_metadata does not test list image metadata correctly
   since the volume_image_metadata attribute has never been created in the first
   place.

commit_message:
Remove  RBAC test_volume_list_image_metadata test case

Remove the test_volume_list_image_metadata test case as it duplicates with
test_list_volumes_details_image_metadata in test_volume_metadata_rbac.py.  Also,
test_volume_list_image_metadata does not test list image metadata correctly
since the volume_image_metadata attribute has never been created in the first
place.

Change-Id: I07c3971f5bdb4255105612538e58c79d69daa691

commit_message:
Replace ovsfw tempest job with iptables-hybrid tempest job

In commit [1] openvswitch firewall driver is switched to be
default one used in devstack.
So various tempest jobs will use this driver and it will be
tested.
We now need separate job to test non-default firewall driver
which currently is iptables-hybrid driver.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568297/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568297/
Change-Id: I6061a173c95c8a41a61bfa298ae5964cc9b5d2e8

commit_message:
Driver usage example is not correct

In the documentation it defines 'driver.slow-driver' and
'driver.fast-driver'.  Then, however, when their implementation
status is indicated it has 'driver-slow-driver' and
'driver-faster-driver' which isn't correct.

Change-Id: I01f4d268eed735cc8c013d016e4aac69aa272b33

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 14:17:04.000000000', 'message': "neutron: Use openvswitch firewall driver by default

openvswitch firewall has been in Neutron tree since Newton and has gone
through lots of improvements since including simple upgrade path from
the iptables hybrid driver.

We have a tempest job running in Neutron tree with openvswitch firewall
that's been voting and stable for a while. For neutron_tempest_plugin,
we have had the openvswitch firewall in use since the beginning.

This patch proposes openvswitch firewall driver to become a default
driver for openvswitch agent deployments.

Change-Id: If26d0180e459210511f25f1faa83dd8ccea25ff4
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: Use openvswitch firewall driver by default

openvswitch firewall has been in Neutron tree since Newton and has gone
through lots of improvements since including simple upgrade path from
the iptables hybrid driver.

We have a tempest job running in Neutron tree with openvswitch firewall
that's been voting and stable for a while. For neutron_tempest_plugin,
we have had the openvswitch firewall in use since the beginning.

This patch proposes openvswitch firewall driver to become a default
driver for openvswitch agent deployments.

Change-Id: If26d0180e459210511f25f1faa83dd8ccea25ff4

commit_message:
Fix README setup.py check error

The releases repo added a validation for PyPI meta files.
The command line is "python3 setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict".
It seems '.. include::' directive cannot work in this check
and it blocks the release process.

LINKS.rst is simple enough, so this commit move the content of LINKS.rst
into README.rst and doc/source/index.rst, while they are duplicated.

This is a workaround to make Rocky-2 release work and
hopefully we can find a better solution in near future.

Change-Id: I381b4494744c2f069227e83ae02f4c956633f4b9

The default index isn't created automatically when using
ELK > 5.x. This commit adds a new task into the post-deploy
taskset to force the creation of the default index.

This patch also enforces the kibana config to set index
as defaultIndex without the need for the defaultIndex property
to already exists , preventing the error exposed on the public bug.

Also added a new option named kibana_default_index_options, with
a default index.mapper.dynamic set to true, this option
can be extended by the operator and they will be applied to the index.

commit_message:
[kibana] enforce index creation for ELK > 5 (debian)

The default index isn't created automatically when using
ELK > 5.x. This commit adds a new task into the post-deploy
taskset to force the creation of the default index.

This patch also enforces the kibana config to set index
as defaultIndex without the need for the defaultIndex property
to already exists , preventing the error exposed on the public bug.

Also added a new option named kibana_default_index_options, with
a default index.mapper.dynamic set to true, this option
can be extended by the operator and they will be applied to the index.

Change-Id: Ica63a5fb30947f7ebae6cf8c80500a7dd0907211
Closes-Bug: #1772687
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>

As part of being incorporated into Oslo, the keystoneauth dependency
should be removed.

This patch also works towards implementing pluggable drivers in
oslo_config.

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated in Queens [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I98ce420a4cb886fc90c645236ddb388fa6865ff6
(cherry picked from commit bbc0c6b923639207490658b121dc4f5703e48652)

'}, {'created': '2018-06-04 15:53:10.000000000', 'message': "Retry decorator fix for autoscale delete

deallocate-network-retry

retry fix for VM going to ERROR state during auto-scale delete instance

Delete issued to building server leaves the instance in error state due to
not able to deallocate network error.During auto-scale delete, some of
the machines go into ERROR state rather than being deleted.This happens
once in a while during deletion of the instances at scale.Log line for
the failure is 'Setting instance vm_state to ERROR',
Failure in do_terminate_instance.

Change-Id: Ie27a19113b600a2e8222d39a5633504fd775a5ef
Closes-Bug: #1765942
"}]
commit_message:
Retry decorator fix for autoscale delete

deallocate-network-retry

retry fix for VM going to ERROR state during auto-scale delete instance

Delete issued to building server leaves the instance in error state due to
not able to deallocate network error.During auto-scale delete, some of
the machines go into ERROR state rather than being deleted.This happens
once in a while during deletion of the instances at scale.Log line for
the failure is 'Setting instance vm_state to ERROR',
Failure in do_terminate_instance.

Change-Id: Ie27a19113b600a2e8222d39a5633504fd775a5ef
Closes-Bug: #1765942

commit_message:
Change restart the services command

Remove service restart command for openstack-barbican-api.
Add service restart command for barbican-keystone-listener
, barbican-worker and apache2.

Change-Id: I7cd12f6dc8102f1cdde135abc44013f521cc41c6
Close-bug: #1750965
(cherry picked from commit 474abafd753dd80efc324ab7631c8ef3b7c4d67a)

commit_message:
Switch carbon and nitrogen to release

This is a combination of 2 commits.

This is the 1st commit message:

devstack: teach how to handle latest ODL release

This is the commit message #2:

Switch carbon and nitrogen to release

Carbon and nitrogen ODL versions were moved in nexus from snapshot to
release as they are no longer maintained.

This patch allows retrieval from there instead.

Change-Id: I3c6e25d2ce147bf3159606e6e6f490e5249e8226

commit_message:
Add validation to avoid having an Overcloud with underscores.

We need to ensure the Overcloud is fixed before proceeding with
an Upgrade.

Change-Id: Id7bbbe0df21de16c4eab5c9a049c0d853443ff23
Closes-Bug: 1775404

commit_message:
Document the China registry mirror

Kolla always fails to pull kolla images. This patch is to document
how to use the China registry mirror to avoid the failure of pulling
kolla images.

Change-Id: Ib31b3ee6183c12467df4f28f8dff438ed6e9d41c

messages:
[{'account_id': 28394, 'date': '2018-06-05 14:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-05 14:15:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28394, 'date': '2018-06-05 14:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28394, 'date': '2018-06-05 15:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28394, 'date': '2018-06-06 08:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-06-06 09:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Implements: adds FIBRE_CHANNEL support

This change adds the FIBRE_CHANNEL as a supported protocol to the
brick cinderclient extension. The change was tested with a 3PAR
storage backend and a Debian 9.2 Host OS installation.

Cinder volume driver used for testing was:

 cinder.volume.drivers.hpe.hpe_3par_fc.HPE3PARFCDriver

Storage backend hardware used for testing was:

 HP 3PAR 7400c

Amended to resolve pep8/documentation errors as reported by Zuul

Change-Id: Ie7e8b7e3141600de0d711a7bca94256d4d7f58ab

commit_message:
Graceful OVS restart for DVR

Graceful OVS restart that was intoduced in I95070d8218859d4fff1d572c1792cdf6019dd7ea
missed that flows are also dropped in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br.

Related-bug: #1383674

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-02 01:23:28.000000000', 'message': 'FC fix for scanning only connected HBA's

When provided an initiator target map and attempting a rescan
in LinuxFibreChannel.rescan_hosts(...) if the system doesn't
yet have /sys/class/fc_host/fc_transport/** directories then
we can get into a position where the call to
LinuxFibreChannel._get_hba_channel_scsi_target will return
"None". Later on when we iterate through "process" and attempt
to iterate on "cts" this will raise an exception. We used to
fall back to a wildcard scan, and still do if no target map
is provided. This fix will do just that, for cases where we
don't have enough other information we just use wildcards.

In testing it seems like this happens on first-time connections
to a target after the ACLs have been setup on the arrays for
the initiator. After that we can get the HBA channel and SCSI
target with the grep call in _get_hba_channel_scsi_target

Change-Id: Ifd79b055882bb513fccf21d584baaeb1d60e67f2
Closes-Bug: #1774283
'}]
commit_message:
FC fix for scanning only connected HBA's

When provided an initiator target map and attempting a rescan
in LinuxFibreChannel.rescan_hosts(...) if the system doesn't
yet have /sys/class/fc_host/fc_transport/** directories then
we can get into a position where the call to
LinuxFibreChannel._get_hba_channel_scsi_target will return
"None". Later on when we iterate through "process" and attempt
to iterate on "cts" this will raise an exception. We used to
fall back to a wildcard scan, and still do if no target map
is provided. This fix will do just that, for cases where we
don't have enough other information we just use wildcards.

In testing it seems like this happens on first-time connections
to a target after the ACLs have been setup on the arrays for
the initiator. After that we can get the HBA channel and SCSI
target with the grep call in _get_hba_channel_scsi_target

Change-Id: Ifd79b055882bb513fccf21d584baaeb1d60e67f2
Closes-Bug: #1774283

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 07:29:34.000000000', 'message': "Remove useless retrieval of karaf for ODL image

When building images with type=source, the opendaylight would retrieve
a 400MB+ archive for distribution-karaf-0.6.2-Carbon.tar.gz and did
absolutely nothing with it since the ODL image installs the necessary
bits from distro packages unconditionally.

This commit removes the retrieval of the karaf archive. This should
help make the gate more stable as we've seen the build timing out when
retrieving the karaf archive.

Change-Id: I0e31d91b4e1ad4ae4ec5c25847c7798724ed9eea
Closes-Bug: #1774851
"}]
commit_message:
Remove useless retrieval of karaf for ODL image

When building images with type=source, the opendaylight would retrieve
a 400MB+ archive for distribution-karaf-0.6.2-Carbon.tar.gz and did
absolutely nothing with it since the ODL image installs the necessary
bits from distro packages unconditionally.

This commit removes the retrieval of the karaf archive. This should
help make the gate more stable as we've seen the build timing out when
retrieving the karaf archive.

Change-Id: I0e31d91b4e1ad4ae4ec5c25847c7798724ed9eea
Closes-Bug: #1774851

commit_message:
Add attribute propagate_uplink_status to port

This attribute indicates if the state of the port will follow
the state of its parent port. The first use case of this attribute
is SR-IOV. If it is a VF port, setting this attribute can make
the VF link state follow the state of the PF. In the future,
this attribute might be reused for trunk/subports as well.

Change-Id: If622b8df6b890530adace4821a6408ef942cc80a
Partial-Bug: #1722720

commit_message:
Install sensu from centos-opstools

This should help improve stability overall, in exchange for slightly
older package version.

Cap all the sensu plugins to their known major version that works with
the ruby interpreter shipped with the current version of
rhel/centos/oraclelinux -- currently ruby 2.0. All sensu plugins use
semantic versioning so we're assured they don't introduce breaking
changes in the capped major version.

Change-Id: Ic5ca679c40da3e466433b0e04f762d2bbffbf156
Closes-Bug: #1774123

subject: Create docker-puppet.sh only once to avoid ETXTBSY errors
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-06-04 14:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-06-06 09:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-06 10:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-04 14:58:54.000000000', 'message': 'Create docker-puppet.sh only once to avoid ETXTBSY errors

We currently create /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh
inside the mp_puppet_config() function which then gets
invoked in parallel via the following:

  p = multiprocessing.Pool(process_count)
  returncodes = list(p.map(mp_puppet_config, process_map))

This is problematic because we have the following potential race:
1) Process A opens /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh for writing
2) Process B runs docker run and has the following bind mount:
   /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh:/var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh:z
3) Process B will fail because an exec of a file being written to
   will return ETXTBSY

The deployment can fail due to the above with the following error:
[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# docker ps -a
CONTAINER ID IMAGE COMMAND CREATED STATUS PORTS NAMES
a401108cd827 192.168.24.1:8787/tripleoqueens/centos-binary-glance-api:current-tripleo-rdo "/var/lib/docker-p..." 19 minutes ago Exited (1) 19 minutes ago docker-puppet-glance_api
[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# docker logs docker-puppet-glance_api
standard_init_linux.go:178: exec user process caused "text file busy"

Since /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh never changes
there is really no need to create it multiple times. Let's just
create it once before spawning the multiple docker run commands
so we avoid any ETXTBSY errors.

Ran 20 successful deployments in sequence with this change applied.

Change-Id: I16b19488ce9f1411273459576db76d16b318dacb
Closes-Bug: #1760787
(cherry picked from commit 1037786b6c1ee9bb135d94c42f45194b3d31835e)
'}]
commit_message:
Create docker-puppet.sh only once to avoid ETXTBSY errors

We currently create /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh
inside the mp_puppet_config() function which then gets
invoked in parallel via the following:

  p = multiprocessing.Pool(process_count)
  returncodes = list(p.map(mp_puppet_config, process_map))

This is problematic because we have the following potential race:
1) Process A opens /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh for writing
2) Process B runs docker run and has the following bind mount:
   /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh:/var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh:z
3) Process B will fail because an exec of a file being written to
   will return ETXTBSY

The deployment can fail due to the above with the following error:
[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# docker ps -a
CONTAINER ID IMAGE COMMAND CREATED STATUS PORTS NAMES
a401108cd827 192.168.24.1:8787/tripleoqueens/centos-binary-glance-api:current-tripleo-rdo "/var/lib/docker-p..." 19 minutes ago Exited (1) 19 minutes ago docker-puppet-glance_api
[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# docker logs docker-puppet-glance_api
standard_init_linux.go:178: exec user process caused "text file busy"

Since /var/lib/docker-puppet/docker-puppet.sh never changes
there is really no need to create it multiple times. Let's just
create it once before spawning the multiple docker run commands
so we avoid any ETXTBSY errors.

Ran 20 successful deployments in sequence with this change applied.

Change-Id: I16b19488ce9f1411273459576db76d16b318dacb
Closes-Bug: #1760787
(cherry picked from commit 1037786b6c1ee9bb135d94c42f45194b3d31835e)

commit_message:
Remove jobs from beaker-* projects

We have never committed any code to these projects. We probably won't do
so anytime soon. In order to make cleaning up and migrating legacy
beaker jobs easier, stop requiring these jobs so that we can remove them
directly from openstack-zuul-jobs.

Change-Id: If433e0c2e6821baaa86ef5ca9788bb72c1557c07

[{'account_id': 9820, 'date': '2018-06-03 09:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21113, 'date': '2018-06-04 21:58:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-06 07:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-06 07:22:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

At first I thought it was ok to raise the timeout to get the 400MB+ of distribution-karaf-0.6.2-Carbon.tar.gz but then I realized we don't do anything with the retrieved archive! ODL image is binary only, I'll push a patch to remove it."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-06 07:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@mandre Is used by overrides in case a source build for ODL is needed https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/contrib/template-override/opendaylight-template-overrides.j2

I dont think we should support such case upstream'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-06 07:32:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'll push a patch to remove it.

Done at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572684/"}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-06-06 07:42:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@egonzales: I forgot about the templates-override for ODL, but it seems the documentation already explains how to setup the kolla-build.conf to retrieve the karaf archive. We shouldn't provide a default value for it otherwise it will pull the archive even when not building with the template override (as does CI).

https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/template-override/opendaylight-source.html#building-opendaylight-container-images"}, {'account_id': 9820, 'date': '2018-06-06 12:52:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Martin, make sense to not download it.
The problem should be fixed in [1], I will abandon this patch.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572684/1"}, {'account_id': 9820, 'date': '2018-06-06 12:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-03 09:37:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix kolla-build-centos-source CI Job failed sometimes

kolla-build-centos-source CI Job will failed randomly[1][2].
This is because request timeout to get archive from mirror.
This patch increase default timeout from 120s to 300s.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/28/517828/2/check/kolla-build-centos-source/b6e4d5b/logs/build/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/75/571175/4/check/kolla-build-centos-source/68ae60b/logs/build/

Change-Id: Idac1436778db7fb71c478b1d75257ebc47d230d0
Closes-Bug: #1774851
'}]
commit_message:
Fix kolla-build-centos-source CI Job failed sometimes

kolla-build-centos-source CI Job will failed randomly[1][2].
This is because request timeout to get archive from mirror.
This patch increase default timeout from 120s to 300s.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/28/517828/2/check/kolla-build-centos-source/b6e4d5b/logs/build/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/75/571175/4/check/kolla-build-centos-source/68ae60b/logs/build/

Change-Id: Idac1436778db7fb71c478b1d75257ebc47d230d0
Closes-Bug: #1774851

commit_message:
fix sahara service-type

the sahara service-type is data-processing,not data_processing
if use data_processing,the sahara client will take mistake.
refer to [1]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/sahara/latest/install/installation-guide.html#common-installation-steps
Co-Authored-By: zhulingjie <easyzlj@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4c6704a81921bf713073451dc4e93e44234e5a7c

commit_message:
[WIP] Add release to the gating repo tarball name

For n -> n + 1 we need to know the gating repo release to not install it.

Maybe it's better to just add relase to the compressed_gating_repo ansible fact or both.

Change-Id: Ic5fb87c538e2efc6a5364f81281967537a76b8b6

commit_message:
centos: use DELOREAN repo directly on all architectures

CentOS 7.5 added 'contentdir' variable to yum package manager. We handle
it already in Kolla.

RDO team started using it in DELOREAN repo file so we can use it
directly on all architectures.

Change-Id: I59fa4d3fdbd0d0e2ed52c2725684c0033451e232

subject: Update storage CDM collector
messages: [{'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2018-05-23 01:59:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2018-06-06 07:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2018-06-06 11:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 01:59:22.000000000', 'message': "Update storage CDM collector

Storage CDM can not be build for some environment such as
the one using VMwareVcVmdkDriver, since some attributes of
Storage CDM'S pool element can be 'unknown'.

This patch updates storage CDM collector to raise watcher
specific exception if some attributes of storage CDM'S pool
element is 'unknown'

Change-Id: If75a909025c8d764e4de6e20f058b84e23123c1a
Closes-Bug: #1751206
"}]
commit_message:
Update storage CDM collector

Storage CDM can not be build for some environment such as
the one using VMwareVcVmdkDriver, since some attributes of
Storage CDM'S pool element can be 'unknown'.

This patch updates storage CDM collector to raise watcher
specific exception if some attributes of storage CDM'S pool
element is 'unknown'

Change-Id: If75a909025c8d764e4de6e20f058b84e23123c1a
Closes-Bug: #1751206

subject: Disable the pip version check
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-23 08:29:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-23 12:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/python-build-install-simplification to bp/python-build-install-simplification-stable/queens'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-04 01:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-06 11:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 08:29:42.000000000', 'message': "Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the test for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
(cherry picked from commit 70b8cd5737cdf2adfe69c0cea6859118c45ae878)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the test for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
(cherry picked from commit 70b8cd5737cdf2adfe69c0cea6859118c45ae878)

commit_message:
Upgrade: OVS workaround update dependancies together

Dependancies of OVS can have interdependancies and we need to
update them in batch. Also we need to run their scriptlets!

Resolves: rhbz#1583783
Closes-Bug: #1774416

Change-Id: I5ab79c0572af6ef0d00dbb58e6859c0f9859fe9a

Two options

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-04 15:36:42.000000000', 'message': 'Never remove the ansible_inventory if --dry-run is used

We currently do this:
if [ "$OPT_RETAIN_INVENTORY_FILE" = 0 ]; then
     # Clear out inventory file to avoid tripping over data
     # from a previous invocation
     rm -f $ANSIBLE_INVENTORY

This is very unexpected for a first-time user that has already deployed
a system and would like to inspect the tasks.

Let's remove it when we do not use the --dry-run option

Closes-Bug: #1775024

Change-Id: Ic52436ae2d5983e15f4e128edf1562510c3f7259
'}]
commit_message:
Never remove the ansible_inventory if --dry-run is used

We currently do this:
if [ "$OPT_RETAIN_INVENTORY_FILE" = 0 ]; then
     # Clear out inventory file to avoid tripping over data
     # from a previous invocation
     rm -f $ANSIBLE_INVENTORY

This is very unexpected for a first-time user that has already deployed
a system and would like to inspect the tasks.

Let's remove it when we do not use the --dry-run option

Closes-Bug: #1775024

Change-Id: Ic52436ae2d5983e15f4e128edf1562510c3f7259

commit_message:
Make Swift playbook usable without tripleo-ansible-inventory

Using tripleo-ansible-inventory does currently not work when used during
the deployment (see related bug), thus falling back to using temporary
URLs.

Related-Bug: 1741875
Change-Id: Ie21caa29956eb683ad2994b73d2a947bec81867f

[{'created': '2018-06-06 08:57:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix README setup.py check error

The releases repo added a validation for PyPI meta files.
The command line is "python3 setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict".
Violation is found in README.rst in networking-bagpipe and
it blocks the release process.

All references in README.rst need to work only with README file.

Change-Id: I647ed8a15cbe6ac60272d21db18602bf2d1eea41
'}]
commit_message:
Fix README setup.py check error

The releases repo added a validation for PyPI meta files.
The command line is "python3 setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict".
Violation is found in README.rst in networking-bagpipe and
it blocks the release process.

All references in README.rst need to work only with README file.

Change-Id: I647ed8a15cbe6ac60272d21db18602bf2d1eea41

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: Update object lifecycle managers

Update generic and proxy object lifecycle managers:
- Add method to clear all objects based on filter method result,
- Add method to check if user is using object.

Add shared proxy class to manage lifecycle of dataplane objects that could be
shared between VPN instances.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: I865de5998478fcbda782095d33ad8eb12d45cac6

commit_message:
undercloud: save Rabbit credentials when upgrading

When upgrading from a non-containerized undercloud, we want to also save
the RabbitMQ credentials instead of generating new ones.

This patch will try to re-use existing username/password and also the
cookie that were used when deploying the undercloud for the first time.

Change-Id: Idcfce4688728ce1e81f771ac05b35e9661d8d5e9
Closes-Bug: #1774927

[{'created': '2018-06-05 11:08:29.000000000', 'message': "Don't uninstall flow tables in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br

Br-int's flow tables are already uninstalled in setup_integration_br.
And setup_integration_br will install some default flows. If we still
uninstall flow tables of br-int  in setup_integration_br, these default
flow tables will be missing.

Closes-Bug: #1775146
Change-Id: I4ec6a96e9f778d2d5f3879c1da1fc621caa9d142
"}]
commit_message:
Don't uninstall flow tables in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br

Br-int's flow tables are already uninstalled in setup_integration_br.
And setup_integration_br will install some default flows. If we still
uninstall flow tables of br-int  in setup_integration_br, these default
flow tables will be missing.

Closes-Bug: #1775146
Change-Id: I4ec6a96e9f778d2d5f3879c1da1fc621caa9d142

subject: Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 10:43:47.000000000', 'message': "Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.

neutron-openvswitch-agent will refresh flows when it's restarted.
But the port's binding status is not changed, update_port_postcommit
will be skipped at function '_update_individual_port_db_status' in
'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', l2pop don't handle DVR ports, the
fdb entries about DVR port will not be added.

So, we can't skip DVR port at notify_l2pop_port_wiring when agent
is restared.

Closes-Bug: #1773286
Change-Id: I964d720d863d4b04f0f75d4c66d135325d2ce83d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.

neutron-openvswitch-agent will refresh flows when it's restarted.
But the port's binding status is not changed, update_port_postcommit
will be skipped at function '_update_individual_port_db_status' in
'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', l2pop don't handle DVR ports, the
fdb entries about DVR port will not be added.

So, we can't skip DVR port at notify_l2pop_port_wiring when agent
is restared.

Closes-Bug: #1773286
Change-Id: I964d720d863d4b04f0f75d4c66d135325d2ce83d

commit_message:
Rename test files to test_* pattern

We're going to switch to default Django test runner by default.
This patch renames test files to make tests descoverable by
Nose and Django test runners without addidional configuration.

This patch alse removes executable flag from test/helpers.py.

Related blueprint: improve-horizon-testing

Change-Id: I48e8f3760c06ab3713e7244536cccd27b2342ab2

commit_message:
[WIP] Support networking-generic-switch ML2 plugin

This ML2 plugin is designed to work with Ironic network switching
functionality and supports a large number of physical switches via
the netmiko library.

Change-Id: I83f66585dc1ebd0f9c4f398368cbd06d9d7d8bd0
Implements: blueprint networking-generic-switch

[{'created': '2018-05-30 14:11:01.000000000', 'message': 'Enable DVR on compute role to better support upgrading

The ComputeDVR role was added new for queens/rocky. This is preferred
for new deployments, but upgrading deployments will still be using the
Compute role. This patch adds role-specific parameters for configuring
on those hosts.

Related-Bug: #1774199
Change-Id: Iab42ae0fb13e8e92cc9903432a95e04a94a5913c
'}, {'created': '2018-05-31 13:20:49.000000000', 'message': 'Enable DVR on compute role to better support upgrading

When deploying DVR and Neutron agents in containers, the agents are
configured using role-specific parameters. This patch adds the required
parameters to the Compute role so the agents are configured properly on
upgrade.

Change-Id: Iab42ae0fb13e8e92cc9903432a95e04a94a5913c

Support containerized DVR in compute role

This patch adds the required parameters to the Compute role so the
agents are configured properly on upgrade.

Related-Bug: #1774199

commit_message:
Change reserved keyword 'action' to 'kayobe_action'

For several roles (cadvisor, inspection-store, docker-registry, etc.),
we use an 'action' variable, in a similar manner to kolla-ansible,
to determine the current action being performed (deploy,
reconfigure, upgrade). It is likely this information will be
useful for custom playbooks, so we should expose it. The 'action'
keyword is reserved, and its use triggers a warning, so we change its
name to kayobe_action before advertising it to users.

Change-Id: I5ffbb8b014a31e27141bfc8bf780297d81c840be
Story: 2001663
Task: 12604

[{'created': '2018-04-12 11:11:49.000000000', 'message': "Support installing galaxy roles from kayobe-config

Adds support for installing Ansible roles from Galaxy based on a
requirements.yml file in the kayobe configuration repository.

Roles are installed during 'kayobe control host bootstrap' and upgraded
during 'kayobe control host upgrade'. Custom roles are defined in a
requirements file at '$KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH/ansible/requirements.yml'. The
roles will be installed to '$KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH/ansible/roles/'.

This forms the basis for supporting customisable extensions to the
standard workflows.

Change-Id: I4cd732623fc26986d5814be487c7930501ac7b7c

commit_message:
Support installing galaxy roles from kayobe-config

Adds support for installing Ansible roles from Galaxy based on a
requirements.yml file in the kayobe configuration repository.

Roles are installed during 'kayobe control host bootstrap' and upgraded
during 'kayobe control host upgrade'. Custom roles are defined in a
requirements file at '$KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH/ansible/requirements.yml'. The
roles will be installed to '$KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH/ansible/roles/'.

This forms the basis for supporting customisable extensions to the
standard workflows.

Change-Id: I4cd732623fc26986d5814be487c7930501ac7b7c
Story: 2001663
Task: 12599

commit_message:
Adds configuration option for separate cleaning network

To improve network isolation it is desirable to perform
cleaning on a separate network. A new network, `cleaning_net`
was added. If cleaning_net_name is not overriden cleaning
will still be performed on the workload provisioning network
to maintain backwards compatability.

Story: 2002097
Task: 19775
Change-Id: I7dd246ca830820f9c2468b281f6ac8f0db2e9cbe

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the cinder service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation
* Add oslo.messaging to inventory
* Add release note

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: I6b29b89c80889eff34fe78674cd888ea9d398388

commit_message:
Explicitly use django_nose.NoseTestSuiteRunner

Horizon is going to switch to Django Test Runner [1].
To not break Watcher Dashboard we need to use Nose Test Runner
until we'll be ready to remove Nose from watcher-dashboard.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544296/

Change-Id: Ia8a6c185cfea09e476c2f5fbe134cc84f450c096

commit_message:
Bump minor version of mariadb

This bumps the mariadb version, by adding a new repo.
As the package state is by default to "latest", the
addition of the new repo will trigger an upgrade
of the mariadb version.

Change-Id: Id68221847e62626f13d1d871c1dee28508e4896a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572366/

Also take a reasonable guess as to whether HTTPS/wsgi.url_scheme ought to be updated.

commit_message:
Fix some inconsistencies in doc

It's more common to format words like "nova-compute" with "``"
instead of "`", and there is no need to format words like "RPC".
This patch also fixes a few syntax and typo issues.

And as requested, some typos in aggregates.rst are corrected to
improve readability.

Change-Id: I4d9c184e1448c8ea9973302f53e1773a7b66cd1e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 08:56:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for tls-certificates interface

To use the tls-certificates interface clients relate to the vault charm. If the
charms CA is not ready yet the charm will not update the relation data. To
prepare the CA an operator needs to run the get_csr action to retrieve the csr for
the intermediate ca the charm has prepared. The operator should sign the csr with
the root CA and then upload the root CA cert and signed csr to the vault charm via
the upload-signed-csr action. Running this action will trigger the vault charm to
process any outstanding certificate requests and to update the relation data
accordingly.

The update includes:

* New action get_csr to retrieve a csr for the intermediate ca for the charm pki
* New action upload-signed-csr to upload a signed intermediate csr
* Charm now provides tls-certificates interface
* Update vault access acl to allow charm full access to charm-pki-*. Currently
  the only pki mount point the charm uses is charm-pki-local
* Various generic helpers to lib.charm.vault
* New module lib.charm.vault_pki which handles interactions between the charm and
  the vault pki api
* Add handler to reactive.vault_handlers for reacting to certificate requests

Change-Id: I1681b9f2defcfbf7c06ede83c88c507dcf92a7ce
'}, {'created': '2018-05-09 09:18:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for tls-certificates interface

update the relation data accordingly.

The update includes:

* New action get_csr to retrieve a csr for the intermediate ca for
  the charm pki
* New action upload-signed-csr to upload a signed intermediate csr
* Charm now provides tls-certificates interface
* Update vault access acl to allow charm full access to charm-pki-*.
  Currently the only pki mount point the charm uses is
  charm-pki-local
* Various generic helpers to lib.charm.vault
* New module lib.charm.vault_pki which handles interactions between
  the charm and the vault pki api
* Add handler to reactive.vault_handlers for reacting to certificate

Change-Id: I1681b9f2defcfbf7c06ede83c88c507dcf92a7ce

update the relation data accordingly.

The update includes:

* New action get_csr to retrieve a csr for the intermediate ca for
  the charm pki
* New action upload-signed-csr to upload a signed intermediate csr
* Charm now provides tls-certificates interface
* Update vault access acl to allow charm full access to charm-pki-*.
  Currently the only pki mount point the charm uses is
  charm-pki-local
* Various generic helpers to lib.charm.vault
* New module lib.charm.vault_pki which handles interactions between
  the charm and the vault pki api
* Add handler to reactive.vault_handlers for reacting to certificate
  requests

Depends-On: I6222e5eb9c8a0a5f079ecc2e5e5c97abc1c39515
Change-Id: I1681b9f2defcfbf7c06ede83c88c507dcf92a7ce
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for tls-certificates interface

To use the tls-certificates interface clients relate to the vault
charm. If the charms CA is not ready yet the charm will not update
the relation data. To prepare the CA an operator needs to run the
get_csr action to retrieve the csr for the intermediate ca the charm
has prepared. The operator should sign the csr with the root CA and
then upload the root CA cert and signed csr to the vault charm via
the upload-signed-csr action. Running this action will trigger the
vault charm to process any outstanding certificate requests and to
update the relation data accordingly.

The update includes:

* New action get_csr to retrieve a csr for the intermediate ca for
  the charm pki
* New action upload-signed-csr to upload a signed intermediate csr
* Charm now provides tls-certificates interface
* Update vault access acl to allow charm full access to charm-pki-*.
  Currently the only pki mount point the charm uses is
  charm-pki-local
* Various generic helpers to lib.charm.vault
* New module lib.charm.vault_pki which handles interactions between
  the charm and the vault pki api
* Add handler to reactive.vault_handlers for reacting to certificate
  requests

Depends-On: I6222e5eb9c8a0a5f079ecc2e5e5c97abc1c39515
Change-Id: I1681b9f2defcfbf7c06ede83c88c507dcf92a7ce

commit_message:
Use leader storage for bootstrap indication

Rendering of the percona configuration file can happen very early
in unit lifecycle when the cluster relation has not been joined
so the only reliable way to determine whether the cluster is already
bootstrapped is to look at data presented from the leader unit
via leader storage.

Change-Id: Ib9938feaf3c2569887ed12ff47348d595abfe8a5
Closes-Bug: 1756308

commit_message:
Ensure cluster is not re-bootstrapped

Once the local ceph-mon and ceph-mgr units have been boostrapped,
there is no need to re-run the bootstrap process - it is idempotent
but is just extra cycles during the charm hook execution with a
confusing status message for end users.

Change-Id: I5af5acf4ed56d6ccb015801541ddeb99249034ad

commit_message:
Check repo_built result when running install-built-repo

In case of n -> n + 1 upgrade, install-built-repo runs
even if it's if there is no gating repo at n + 1.

Change-Id: I137a85e9d8e4bed2489aaacee8deaddc423b32f9

commit_message:
Use Octavia for LoadBalancer type service

In the OpenStack deployment with Octavia service enabled, the octavia
service should be used not only for master nodes high availability, but
also for k8s LoadBalancer type service implementation as well.

Change-Id: Ib61f59507510253794a4780a91e49aa6682c8039
Closes-Bug: #1770133
(cherry picked from commit 2cc57c538627ae51c8b23ff33705c4f4fe01cc35)

I have not been able to think of/learn/find a better way of doing this.  Honestly I don't know if this will have some other problem too, we have "fixed" capture of command line tools several times now.  But it seems to make sense decoding the output ourselves and ignoring errors.  Thanks'}]

commit_message:
Fix encoding issue during processing output

When using the package-installs element there can be some encoding
problems if the package installation emits unparsable output
[1]. However in this case we just want to forward the output to the
console which normally can handle this correctly. In order to fix this
switch off universal_newlines processing such that we just operate on
bytes.

Further we have to decode the lines without setting the locale and
ignoring errors. This is required because print encodes without
setting the locale and thus we need to filter/modify the stream such
that it doesn't crash.

[1] Traceback:
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 | Traceback (most recent call last):
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 |   File "/usr/local/bin/package-installs-v2", line 137, in <module>
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 |     main()
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 |   File "/usr/local/bin/package-installs-v2", line 130, in main
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 |     process_output(install_args, follow=True)
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 |     for line in iter(proc.stdout.readline, ''):
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 |   File "/usr/lib/python3.5/encodings/ascii.py", line 26, in decode
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 |     return codecs.ascii_decode(input, self.errors)[0]
2018-03-01 09:58:00.515 | UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc3 in position 34: ordinal not in range(128)

Change-Id: Ie4af9b4523459a630cfb98d09093bfe9ef7aa61e

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Strip signed certificate

Certificate (ca.crt) has to be striped for some application parsers
as they might require pure base64 representation of
certificate itself, without empty characters
at the beginning nor the end of file

Change-Id: I85457e0e2adcf21003300fafc6e2502f74b1afb5

commit_message:
Improve reproducer script

Solve problen with script on CSB when using old openstack libraries
by using python system interpretator instead of system-packages in
virtual environment.
Create workspace directory if doesn't exist.
Always run pip with --upgrade in virtualenv.
Set host key checking to false to prevent SSH errors for reused
public IPs of openstack cloud.

Closes-Bug: #1741985

Change-Id: Ia20d62a7cd92c3391467d27a22c75ed713a8c957

subject: [genereatepot] Generalizes with msggrep
messages:
[{'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-11 13:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-11 13:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-11 13:31:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-11 13:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I tried to reflect I88f11b8fef7221129c81493a17830f271b484767 as two different approaches:

1. Patch 2
 - Specifies which files to ignore in .gettext-ignore
 - Simpler than Patch 3: just enumerates which files and/or dirs to be ignored from pot

2. Patch 3
 - Using msggrep is more elegant since this sphinx-build generates warnings since original csv file size is zero.
 - .gettext-exclude.sh script describes how to exclude from pot
 - If exclusion logic would be complex in different projects rather than just specifying files, patch would be nice I think.

Separating which things to exclude or how to exclude into a different file in doc/source would make generatepot method available to other doc repositories.'}, {'account_id': 6882, 'date': '2018-02-12 17:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

@ian

I think the `.gettext-exclued.sh` file should be in` tools` rather than `doc/source`.

If the run script is in the `doc/source` directory, it may not be easy to modify or check.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-13 01:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > @ian

Thank u. I will think about your comments and reflect new idea later.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-15 07:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-15 07:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-15 07:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:33:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:44:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-27 12:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-03-01 11:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

Now I would like to separate two things - the first is to use msggrep as a separated file and the second is to use another method: "python setup.py build_sphinx" instead of current method. The second is to use a kind of unified gettext build method for all the doc targets in all the repos, but I will think about it more and propose it later.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-05 13:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-03-06 16:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-14 19:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-05-23 11:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-05-23 12:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-05-23 12:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

When we just wee patch 10, it is just a matter of choice: deleting unnecessary pots vs. using msggrep. If we see broader view, all genereatepot for documents need to use the same logic like https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545377/14/roles/prep-zanata/files/common_translation_update.sh . I hope that openstack/i18n repository would also follow the same logic so I18n team can propose genereatepot and translated document publication to PTI, and would like to kindly listen to reviews from I18n team on my opinion.'}, {'account_id': 6882, 'date': '2018-05-29 11:15:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-30 02:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Other than the indent issue, it looks good.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-05-30 03:11:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-05-30 03:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)

Thank u for the reviews - I fixed indent problems, which I did not pay attention too much.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-30 03:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Final question.

btw, do we want to change PO file structure in the i18n repo?
Normal project docs consist of multiple guides (install, user, admin, contributor and so on), but the i18n doc is only a single document. I am not sure this is what we want.

(I understand you are using the i18n doc to test the project doc translation)'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-05-30 03:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> btw, do we want to change PO file structure in the i18n repo?

- Technically and for governance, I18n repo does not need to follow structures in project docs since I18n repo does not have OpenStack components (e.g., PyPI package) and when I applied a function for project doc generatepot support in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545377/ to i18n repo, there were no problem on generating a pot.

- My testing currently includes horizon, openstack-ansible, and openstack-helm documents + i18n contributor guide :) I have not tested yet building translated documents for horizon, openstack-ansible, and openstack-helm documents but sure such testing is indeed needed.

- But "why not? :)" it would be nice if I18n repo also follows the same structure as project repos, unless the structure might not seem too complicated to translators.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-02 20:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Ian Y. Choi wrote:

> > btw, do we want to change PO file structure in the i18n repo?
>
> - Technically and for governance, I18n repo does not need to follow
> structures in project docs since I18n repo does not have OpenStack
> components (e.g., PyPI package) and when I applied a function for
> project doc generatepot support in
> https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545377/ to i18n repo, there were no
> problem on generating a pot.
>
> - My testing currently includes horizon, openstack-ansible, and
> openstack-helm documents + i18n contributor guide :) I have not
> tested yet building translated documents for horizon, openstack-
> ansible, and openstack-helm documents but sure such testing is
> indeed needed.
>
> - But "why not? :)" it would be nice if I18n repo also follows the
> same structure as project repos, unless the structure might not seem
> too complicated to translators.

Thanks for clarification.
The current i18n doc has no documents in a subdirectory, so I am fine with this version.
I was just afraid to create an extra POT file like doc-xxxx.pot and to force translators to copy existing strings to the new PO file, but it is no longer true now.'}, {'account_id': 6882, 'date': '2018-06-06 06:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-11 13:10:10.000000000', 'message': 'More generic exclusion in pot generation

Using .gettext-ignore file to exclude
in pot generation

Change-Id: Ibe0dcf599ad99db15af1ba50c9ddf0af5487fa24
'}, {'created': '2018-02-11 13:31:31.000000000', 'message': 'More generic exclusion in pot generation

- Utilizes msggrep to filter non-translation targets
  and not to include in translation source pot files
  (.gettext-exclude.sh)

commit_message:
[genereatepot] Generalizes with msggrep

- Changes generatepot logic which is general for all OpenStack
  project documentation translation support
- Generalizes generatepot.sh for all genereatepot jobs
  for project documentmentation translation by separating
  exclusion logic into doc-pot-filter.sh
- Utilizes msggrep to filter non-translation targets
  and not to include in translation source pot files
  doc-pot-filter.sh

Change-Id: Ibe0dcf599ad99db15af1ba50c9ddf0af5487fa24

commit_message:
Rename wrong ovsdpdk precheck file

task file name for prechecks is precheck.yml so rename prechecks.yml to
precheck.yml for ovsdpdk.

Closes-Bug: #1774758

Change-Id: I51415ae4dd0f0fcbe45310ba27cad479ba62bac6
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>

Missing change to add repo to zuul/main.yaml'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2018-06-05 04:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2018-06-05 04:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-05 04:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

The README says "Installs the fog-openstack gem " - but you speak about openstackclient which is something different.

Let's rename to avoid confusion.'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2018-06-05 15:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> The README says "Installs the fog-openstack gem " - but you speak
 > about openstackclient which is something different.
 > 
 > Let's rename to avoid confusion.

We are aware of the potential for confusion by new users, which is why a full documentation rewrite is under way.

At this point, this repo is being distributed by default, and consumed by close to 100% of the consumers of the Chef OpenStack repos. The proposed rename which would cause unanticipated cascading refactors in wrapper cookbooks downstream.

This reason is largely why we are opting to import this repo and deprecate openstack-client. This was also discussed with cdent in respects to https://review.openstack.org/571504'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-06 05:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-06-06 05:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

lgtm. The imported repo seems ok.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-06-06 06:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 02:11:43.000000000', 'message': "Save and close stdout on exit

Redirecting our output through outfilter.py is inherently a bit racy,
since the disk-image-create process will exit, and then you might get
outfilter.py flushing any remaining output as it closes.

On an interactive prompt this might lead to final output overwriting
the prompt, etc.  This can be a bit confusing when you start running
things in a loop.

If we save the original fd, then on the exit path close the redirected
fd's and wait a little bit for final output (as a result of the
close), we get a more consistent output.

Change-Id: I8efe57ab421c1941e99bdecab62c6e21a87e4584
"}, {'created': '2018-05-23 04:33:07.000000000', 'message': "Save and close stdout on exit

Change-Id: I8efe57ab421c1941e99bdecab62c6e21a87e4584
"}]
commit_message:
Save and close stdout on exit

Redirecting our output through outfilter.py is inherently a bit racy,
since the disk-image-create process will exit, and then you might get
outfilter.py flushing any remaining output as it closes.

On an interactive prompt this might lead to final output overwriting
the prompt, etc.  This can be a bit confusing when you start running
things in a loop.

If we save the original fd, then on the exit path close the redirected
fd's and wait a little bit for final output (as a result of the
close), we get a more consistent output.

Change-Id: I8efe57ab421c1941e99bdecab62c6e21a87e4584

[{'created': '2018-06-05 00:14:01.000000000', 'message': '[placement] Do not import oslo_service for log_options

Placement does not use oslo_service, but it is imported for one single
configuration option: "log_options".

This change duplicates that option info nova/conf/placement.py (in the
DEFAULT group) so that oslo_service doesn't need to be imported and its
dependencies (e.g., eventlet) are also not imported.

This is relevant for at least two reasons:

* When running placement in isolation (such as a container) we don't
  want to have to include packages aren't really used

* When placement is extracted we don't want to require things (in
  requirements.txt) that aren't really used.

commit_message:
[placement] Do not import oslo_service for log_options

Placement does not use oslo_service, but it is imported for one single
configuration option: "log_options".

This change duplicates that option info nova/conf/placement.py (in the
DEFAULT group) so that oslo_service doesn't need to be imported and its
dependencies (e.g., eventlet) are also not imported.

This is relevant for at least two reasons:

* When running placement in isolation (such as a container) we don't
  want to have to include packages aren't really used

* When placement is extracted we don't want to require things (in
  requirements.txt) that aren't really used.

Change-Id: I5a19cd3e18bb8c0e0ad2d79f54194f8b941ce307

commit_message:
Reduce path length in PS4 for debug

Strip everything before "site-packages" in the output filename for the
PS4 prompt.  This makes the line in debug logs significantly shorter
as we don't have the full virtualenv path every single time.  The
important thing -- the file being called in the lib/ dir, is retained.

Change-Id: I00706b6f6c0425c7795f997c08ceda3374dc84b5

commit_message:
Use surrogateescape with outfilter.py

When switching to using log-file capture, we're getting

 [gentoo/build-succeeds] outfile.write(ts_line.encode('utf-8'))
 [gentoo/build-succeeds] UnicodeEncodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't
   encode character 'udcc5' in position 59: surrogates not allowed

Use surrogateescape [1] on the output to avoid this

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0383/

Change-Id: I2c2c537296edfa5a8fe661a41bd5bfb3bfcf57e3

It doesn't look like the tempst-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph nor the gate-manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-cephfs-native jobs clone the ceph plugin with zuul cloner -- so they may not be testing these changes correctly, unless I'm missing something."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-10-12 01:37:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> It doesn't look like the tempst-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph nor
 > the gate-manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-cephfs-native jobs clone the
 > ceph plugin with zuul cloner -- so they may not be testing these
 > changes correctly, unless I'm missing something.

What does that mean? I'm interested in this change because I think it's part of our effort to decrease the failure rate of the ceph job in the gate. Are you saying that we can't tell from the gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial job result whether the regex is being honored?"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2017-10-12 01:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Import new repos to openstack-ansible

This patch adds the openstack-ansible-os_zun and
qdrouterd roles.

An individual core group is added for each of them,
but the general OSA core group would have core
capabilities as a back-stop.

Change-Id: I770638dff8a91720cbe9482c9a811239f23e1a44
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/572556

messages:
[{'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-06-05 19:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- cross-cinder-py35: unrecognized error
- cross-neutron-py27: unrecognized error
- cross-nova-functional: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1449136
- cross-nova-py35: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1449136
- requirements-tox-py35-check-uc: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-06-05 21:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.

Change-Id: I89dea8aaeb2a7d42a9ce99e7cb236c491b34c138

commit_message:
Update Django version requirement

Because of the split in global requirement into different
requirements for < and >= python 3.0, the existing requirement
in congress-dashboard no longer passed the requirement-check
at gate.

https://github.com/openstack/requirements/commit/d3f1ef2151ebcdadc18ec3f5b28d13c87bf996fa

Change-Id: I1899356679b43cbb0c6f0cab13856116a1c0cc86

Fix the external_dns_nameservers path

the openstack-helm-infra code is been cloned in current directory,
rather than in /opt, the external_dns_nameservers where find should
be updated.

commit_message:
Disable unit tests for alarm monitoring features

This patch will disable unit tests for alarm monitoring according
to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572050.

After this patch is merged and Heat-translator is released, we
will enable unit tests.

Change-Id: I49fc28857a152879be0fdd9957ff5e4f2f640ac1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 18:37:25.000000000', 'message': "Use a valid default for auth_version

The valid set of values for auth_version does not include
values starting with the 'v'.

In this particular function, the auth_version variable is
only used for comparisons with v3. So, the code worked
correctly. However, let's clean this up in order to reduce
review confusion and defuse possible future landmine in case
of code changes.

Change-Id: I671016d7992a1922b786b4eb8876b3fbb2532e15
"}]
commit_message:
Use a valid default for auth_version

The valid set of values for auth_version does not include
values starting with the 'v'.

In this particular function, the auth_version variable is
only used for comparisons with v3. So, the code worked
correctly. However, let's clean this up in order to reduce
review confusion and defuse possible future landmine in case
of code changes.

Change-Id: I671016d7992a1922b786b4eb8876b3fbb2532e15

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Partial-Bug: #1712399
Change-Id: I2fbf5159febe9d4970935d77bd75e84204710c8e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-17 20:46:42.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp ONTAP: Set new sub-lun clone limit for ONTAP driver

Until ONTAP v8.3, the driver used to perform sub-lun clone of up to 64GB
per operation, but as of v9.1, ONTAP handles only 128MB per operation.
This new limit is causing error on volume extending operations, which
triggers sub-lun cloning when resizing exceeds max-resize-geometry.
For instance, if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, the operation
fails because it triggers a single sub-lun cloning of 1GB.

This fix sets the limit used by sub-lun cloning to 128MB, therefore
if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, it no longer fails, and
instead it will trigger 8 sub-lun cloning operations of 128MB.

Change-Id: Ib294cbdbdfe19d34a7702dafec2c8d29136a2f25
Closes-Bug: #1762424
(cherry picked from commit 029cadbf4067ad6f0bf08588cf439587f3c7052c)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Set new sub-lun clone limit for ONTAP driver

Until ONTAP v8.3, the driver used to perform sub-lun clone of up to 64GB
per operation, but as of v9.1, ONTAP handles only 128MB per operation.
This new limit is causing error on volume extending operations, which
triggers sub-lun cloning when resizing exceeds max-resize-geometry.
For instance, if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, the operation
fails because it triggers a single sub-lun cloning of 1GB.

This fix sets the limit used by sub-lun cloning to 128MB, therefore
if a volume is extended from 1GB to 64GB, it no longer fails, and
instead it will trigger 8 sub-lun cloning operations of 128MB.

Change-Id: Ib294cbdbdfe19d34a7702dafec2c8d29136a2f25
Closes-Bug: #1762424
(cherry picked from commit 029cadbf4067ad6f0bf08588cf439587f3c7052c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-05 19:57:49.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fix listing of instances above API max_limit"

This reverts commit eff607ccef91d09052d58f6798f68d67404f51ce.

There was no apparent need for the change being reverted since
user can list all servers by specifying --limit=1 when running
the nova list command.

The change introduced a problem whereby the first pass to
list instances from the server would get up to
[api]/max_limit (default 1000) results and then call again
with a marker. If the last instance in the list (the marker)
is corrupted in the instance_mappings table in the API DB
by not having an associated cell mapping, listing instances
will always fail with a MarkerNotFound error even though
the CLI user is not passing a marker nor specifying
--limit=-1. The corrupted instance mapping record resulting
in the MarkerNotFound error is something else that should
be fixed on the server side (and likely result in a 500) but
the change in behavior of the CLI makes it always fail
if you hit this even if you're not passing a marker.

Change-Id: Ibb43f500a74733b85bd3242592d36985bfb45856
Closes-Bug: #1773945
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix listing of instances above API max_limit"

This reverts commit eff607ccef91d09052d58f6798f68d67404f51ce.

There was no apparent need for the change being reverted since
user can list all servers by specifying --limit=1 when running
the nova list command.

The change introduced a problem whereby the first pass to
list instances from the server would get up to
[api]/max_limit (default 1000) results and then call again
with a marker. If the last instance in the list (the marker)
is corrupted in the instance_mappings table in the API DB
by not having an associated cell mapping, listing instances
will always fail with a MarkerNotFound error even though
the CLI user is not passing a marker nor specifying
--limit=-1. The corrupted instance mapping record resulting
in the MarkerNotFound error is something else that should
be fixed on the server side (and likely result in a 500) but
the change in behavior of the CLI makes it always fail
if you hit this even if you're not passing a marker.

Change-Id: Ibb43f500a74733b85bd3242592d36985bfb45856
Closes-Bug: #1773945

commit_message:
Cleanup requirements

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567830/ turns out that
trove-dashboard has horizon dependecies explicitly in requirements.txt
even if trove-dashboard does not use directly.
It makes the maintenance of requirements complicated,
so it would be better to drop them.

Change-Id: I8e1e6f4b5c4172df56a698a9091f1e98e9f6b6b8

recheck timeout'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-16 15:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I can imagine a future where we might like projects to be able to view their own usage, but that's the future.

I thought about this and I think we might be thinking along the same lines. The context.can() method takes a target kwarg which if not specified uses the project_id and user_id from the current request context. But I'm thinking in the future if an admin set the rule for /usages to be admin_or_owner, then the target should likely be the project_id from the query parameter, so if I have project A and project B and both have usages, today with rule:admin_api only admins can get usages (backward compat), but if that is changed to rule:admin_or_owner where owner is the matching project_id from the request context, then project A should only see its usages and project B should only see its usages (I think that's how it would work).

Maybe I should put a TODO in the code for that?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-16 15:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Also, the reason I haven't put much thought into "admin_or_owner" for placement is that most of the resources, like resource_providers, don't have "owners" in that they aren't associated with a given project/user.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-05-16 16:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

commit_message:
Add granular policy rules for usages

This adds two granular policy rules for the
resource provider usages and total usages API
endpoints. These both default to the same role:admin
which was hard-coded before with rule:placement so
the change is backward compatible.

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I5662665faa8d09394c9942f07d92a653edfc8bf0
